boardgame.name: Ars Bellum II
boardgame.description:
The basic module contains

1 rulebook of 17 pages with the principles of the game and many illustrated examples
1 player aid
1 board of 108 pawns and markers to play the English and French armies of the campaign
4 scenarios:
the battles of Abbeville (23 August 1346),
Oisemont (23 August 1346),
Gué de Blanquetaque (24 August 1346) and
Crécy (26 August 1346)

4 A3 cards


—description from the publisher (translated)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ars Bellum II: Scénarios "Campagne pour un trône"

boardgame.name: Mystery at Blackthorn Keep
Mystery in Blackthorn Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Can you solve a murder to prevent a war?

A beautiful young woman has vanished and appears to have been murdered in Blackthorn Keep. When everything is more than it seems and every NPC is hiding something, can the players uncover what really happened to Mara Andal? Set against a precarious meeting of two noble houses, this 30 page adventure is bursting with hidden clues, red herrings, nefarious NPCs, political intrigue, and an entire castle to explore.

boardgame.name: Classic F1
boardgame.description:
Classic F1 is a lap by lap reproduction of Formula One auto racing. The game comes with all 33 Formula One champs, as well as all the active drivers from 2019. Every year, car, and constructor for each driver is represented individually and normalized across the history of the sport so you can match, for example, Fangio, Stewart, Senna or Hamilton head-to-head in any car they drove during their careers.
Additional drivers are also available by decade, including a pre-1950s set including such greats as Nuvolari, Rosemeyer and Wimille.

Each driver card has ratings for speed & tactics, qualifying, fastest laps, passing, defending, ability in the rain, accidents and potential mechanical issues, to name but a few. Speedy drivers who excel on fast tracks will do the same here, while tacticians will show their worth on hard to pass tracks like Monaco. Drivers prone to accidents will have more issues than others and cars prone to breaking down with mechanical issues will have difficulty finishing a race.

Each of the tracks from 2019 are represented their own chart which will determine the events during the race based on a die roll. These results may require further checks to the track chart or examining one or more driver ratings for the track action over one or more laps. Tracks that favor a fast driver will do so, while tracks that test a car’s endurance will have more mechanical checks. Each track has its own historic weather check. The ability to pass on the various tracks is represented as well; tracks like Hungaroring will have few passing opportunities, while Monza will have more chances. Some tracks also give the driver the option for a one or two stop pit strategy. No two tracks are alike and the Track Set 2 provides an additional 20 classic circuits including Bremgarten, Detroit, Mt. Tremblant and the daunting Nurburgring "Nordschleife."

Every aspect of F1 is here - driver, car & circuit variety, qualifying, the chaos of lap one, accidents, safety cars and breakdowns. Qualifying takes about a half hour to run; a race can be run in roughly an hour and a half. There is some basic math involved, as you do not move on a track but rather, calculate the number of “spaces moved” for each car/driver, based on the results of a die roll, cross-referenced against the specific race track used as well as the driver/car ratings. The positions after each turn represent a certain amount of time behind the leader and after a pre-determined number of laps have been completed the driver in the lead wins the race. The broad range of random and not-so-random results make no two races the same.

There has never been as detailed a representation of the sport’s history as this game offers.

boardgame.name: Humans
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: Living Failures
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

The Hunter slew your Kin and left the Lady of the Clocktower to bleed out on the throne room floor. But the Hunter didn't see you, hiding there amongst the lumenflowers and the corpses of your brethren. Now, you are all that is left, the only one able to tend to the tower, the garden, the hall, as you and everything around you crumbles into dreams and phantasms. All is quiet. Perhaps a corpse like this should be left well alone...

This work is based on The Wretched, product of Chris Bissette and Loot the Room, and licensed for use under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. This work is inspired by FromSoftware's Bloodborne, and The Wretched was originally inspired by Ben Roswell's You Are Not Alone In This Life and you will die alone out here in the black, which were, in turn, inspired by Takuma Okada's Alone Among the Stars.

Content Warning: bodily trauma, player-character death, themes of loss and despair.

boardgame.name: GreedFall - The de Vespe Conspiracy
Greedfall - The De Vespe Conspiracy
boardgame.description: information regarding Constantin's deceased brother and the matter of his death will be dealt with in the DLC.

boardgame.name: Ruined Temple Lagoon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sunlight filters in through the cracking ceiling on this ruined desert temple, dancing on sparkling water in a clear pool and nearby piles of sand. Tall palms grow out of intricate stone tiles, alongside wildflowers and waterlilies.
Pavers are cracked, as are many of the support pillars holding up the old temple’s roof. Fallen stone and rubble lay dispersed on the ground. You can hear the cry of birds and the flutter of wings from where they roost, high above.

boardgame.name: Broodmother's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A colossal purple spider oversees this sticky lair. It’s filled with large cobwebs, strung between the walls and columns, or like finely woven nets covering gaps in the floor. Yet many more webs are smaller, sticker, and coat the intricately tiled floor like clumps of snow.
Among those smaller cobwebs wait clutches of eggs, ready to hatch at any sign of prey rummaging around them. Scattered amidst this grow strange purple growths, sending out glowing spores into the air.

boardgame.name: Eros's Ancient Machine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Intricately carved sandstone tiles are marked with strange, arcane glyphs. They decorate this ruined desert temple everywhere, though the most magnificent engraving waits in the centre of a platform, surrounded by empty space and connected only by two bridges—one of which is cracked.
Fractured stone pillars hold up the temple’s roof, though the ground is scattered with piles of rubble and fallen sand. Further down, on the levels beneath the platform, more bridges wait, also covered with the glyphs.

boardgame.name: Alkali's Ruined Temple Refuge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Refugee tents are draped throughout this ruined desert temple, alongside crates of food and scattered possessions. A prayer altar is covered with fresh flowers and offerings of grain before a statue of a robed god.
Sunlight filters in through a partially-open ceiling, dancing on sparkling water in a clear pool and on nearby piles of sand. Tall palms grow out of intricate stone tiles, alongside wildflowers and waterlilies. Pavers are cracked, as are many of the support pillars holding up the old temple’s roof.
Fallen stone and rubble lay dispersed on the ground. Desks, tables and crates have knives, letters, writing equipment, as well as food and drink splayed out atop them. You can hear the cry of birds and the flutter of wings from where they roost, high above.

Adventure Seed

You have been paid by some mercenaries to assist them in ousting a group of western soldiers from an ancient temple emplacement on behalf of the King of the Eastern Kingdoms. Only, when you arrive, you don’t see the armed military outpost you were expecting. Instead, you find the ruins of a temple, filled with improvised tents and dirty men, women and children.
If you talk to them, you learn that they’re not rebels, and that this place is known as Alkali’s refuge. Alkali is a cleric who started healing those of either side of the war; both western and eastern soldiers, as well as peasants. They claim it’s a neutral zone, and that their only mission is peace.
WHAT’S HAPPENING? Before this war started the Western King and the Eastern King had arranged their children to marry. But upon meeting the Western King’s son, the Eastern King decided that he was too weak and overly-sentimental to marry his daughter and called the marriage off.
Slighted, the Western King declared war. But now the Eastern King is winning, and peasants in both kingdoms are suffering. The Western Prince, abhorred by the violence and grief the war was bringing, founded this refuge; using his gifts as a cleric to heal soldiers and peasants on either side of the conflict.
The Eastern Princess, unlike her father, fell in love with the Western Prince upon meeting him, and secretly fled to the refuge to join him. Unfortunately, because of this, the Eastern King now believes that the Western King’s forces have kidnapped his daughter.

If you don’t kill the inhabitants of the refuge, the Prince and Princess will go to their parents and beg to be married, for they truly love each other. The Kings, doting on their children, will agree that the war is now needless and taking a toll on their people. As such, they will allow the marriage to go through with their blessing, returning peace to their kingdoms.
Should you choose to kill everyone in the refuge and succeed, however, Alkali will miraculously survive through making a pact on his deathbed with an evil god. He may return later as a necromancer, with his fallen love risen as a banshee.

boardgame.name: Underwater Temple of the Frozen Heart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glistening light filters down through icy water, landing on metal grids and stone walkways in this underwater temple. Further in, a shattered, blue, crystal heart glows from where it lies on cold stone, pinned down by chains held by angelic statues—though it waits above the waterline, sealed behind thick doors.
Ice coats rocks and metal walkways throughout this temple, while fish dart between them. Larger-than-life stone faces stare through the frigid water across the central chamber, while two towers stand watch at the entrance. Large tone steps lead inside, away from the cool, rocky floor.

boardgame.name: Vault of Sunken Riches
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glistening light filters down through water, landing on scattered gold coins and other precious treasures—though they are locked behind thick doors. Outside, fish dart between red, blue and white coral growing off the walls. Next to them larger-than-life stone faces stare across the underwater fortress, while two towers stand watch at the entrance.
Large tone steps lead inside this structure, to stone platforms connected by metal grids—some of which are overgrown with more coral.

boardgame.name: Sorrow's Prison
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This high-security prison casts an aura of sorrow and deep despair upon those who enter it—a spell designed to help those without remorse atone for their sins.
Larger-than-life faces, carved out of the walls, weep rivers of icy water that flow into the fjord beyond the entrance. Two towers stand watch on each side of it, alongside large stone steps leading into the prison, above two metal piers for ships to dock.
Cells are evenly distributed within, more metal walkways connecting them above the river of tears. It is a place few hope to see, as it is said to suck the very life out of you.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Necromancer Lord
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A shattered red crystal heart glows from where it lies on cold stone, pinned down by chains held by angelic statues. Larger-than-life faces, carved out of the walls, weep rivers of a shining crimson substance that flows into the scorched fjord beyond the entrance. Steep soot-stained rocks are bare and stripped of life.
Two towers stand watch on each side of the entrance, alongside large stone steps leading inside the temple. Metal grids join stone platforms, connecting to cells filled with skeletons ready to awaken for their master.

boardgame.name: Underwater Temple of Poseidon's Heart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glistening light filters down through water, landing on metal grids and stone walkways in this underwater temple. Further in, a shattered blue crystal heart glows from where it lies on cold stone, pinned down by chains held by angelic statues.
Fish dart between red, blue and white coral growing off the walls. Next to them larger-than-life stone faces stare across the temple, while two towers stand watch at the entrance. Large tone steps lead inside, to stone platforms connected by metal grids—some of which are overgrown with more coral.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Frozen Heart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A shattered, blue, crystal heart glows from where it lies on cold stone, pinned down by chains held by angelic statues. Larger-than-life faces, carved out of the walls, weep rivers of icy water that flow into the fjord beyond the entrance. Two towers stand watch on each side of it, alongside large stone steps leading to the dry levels above the streams of tears.
Metal grids join stone platforms, all of them dusted with snow or sheets of cracking ice. Small chambers lead off from them and deeper into the rest of the temple.

Adventure Seed

Decades ago the god of light vanished abruptly. Without his blessing, clerics could no longer heal wounds or ailments. Lifespans shortened and pain increased. The mortals, desperate, began turning to plants and minerals to compensate for what had been lost—but it wasn’t the same and the world descended into darkness.
An old crone tells you about a prophecy regarding a group of heroes who will return the broken heart of the god of light, banishing the shadows in the mortal realm. She tells of its location within a great vault, high up in the mountains, only accessible by a frigid river.
WHAT’S HAPPENING? The god, upon seeing a mortal woman he loved dying of old age, gifted her immortality and eternal youth so that they could live together, always. But, after hundreds of years, she claimed she couldn’t take watching those she loved die anymore. He never listened to her pleas, so eventually—desperate—she took her life when he was away, leaving him only a letter and a white rose.
Heartbroken upon discovering her, he removed his heart and chained it away in what was once his temple. It has since frozen over with ice and become uninhabitable, as it is filled with an aura that makes those within it feel intense sorrow and despair. You can find the letter, the frozen rose (perfectly preserved), and her body, all sealed in the sarcophagus his heart rests upon.

After removing his heart, the god went into isolation far, far away from where he sealed it. He doesn’t feel anymore, and has become cold and uncaring to the problems of the mortal world. He no longer gifts his clerics the ability to heal, believing that all mortals die anyway, regardless of what he does—so why heal them at all? Their existences are fast, brutal, and gone within a blink. And besides, when those lives are extended beyond their natural course, mortal minds are so fragile that they break...
You have to bring his heart back to him to restore the balance, but first you must claim it. As it has been so long since it was abandoned, terrible creatures have inhabited this place, things which feed off negative emotions. Once inside you need to make checks to continue despite the crippling feelings, while fighting off the shadowy monsters that have devoured all those who failed to retrieve the heart.
If you succeed, you need to figure out how to heal the broken heart before returning it to him. But how will you heal the heart of a god? And can you survive the despair it brings?

boardgame.name: 100 Items in a Wild West Brave's Pouch
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Brave is a term for the warriors who acts as soldiers, guards, hunters and trackers for their Native American tribe. Traveling across the continent, they explore the land and the people who try to tame it.

This list is intended for any Wild West setting (like Boot Hills, Tall Tales, Deadlands, etc.). This list can be applied to an angry prisoner, a proud leader in field, an injured father fighting for his daughters, or an aging soldier with nothing left to lose. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next tribal defender.

boardgame.name: 50 Locations of the Roaring 20's Vol 1 - Cityworks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This roleplaying tool can be easily applied to any established town or city to give a game master dozens of different groups / places that create the infrastructure that runs the City. This list is intended for any roaring 20’s game (like Gangbusters. Call of Cthulhu, Justice Inc. etc.) that relies on a functioning city as the urban backdrop. While many of these buildings are not intended for public gathering, the fact remains that they store useful records, money, resources, and tools for an enterprising gangster. They can also be the source of many adventures for players in the urban heart of your campaign. For more places that are not government buildings, look no further than the next volume of 50 Locations of the Roaring 20’s for more places that make up a complete city.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Treasures Vol 3: Maps
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Maps are essential recipes for adventure, as they hint and show lost lands, toppled treasures, and foreign foes. Whether they are recorded on paper, parchment, leather, metal, reed, or wood, they offer insight into ways that a team of adventurers can outwit and defeat their enemies on their way to fame, fortune, or freedom.

This list is intended for any fantasy setting (like any version of Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder, Runequest, Palladium, etc.) where civilization is spotty at best, and dozens of races of beings battle for dominance and survival in a world of magic. This list can be applied to a cooling corpse, an treasure chest, or a courier between fortresses. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new location and a touch of mystery to your campaign. Items marked with a “*” are NOT written in common tongue.

boardgame.name: Creature Feature Quarterly Volume 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

13 new monsters with an OSR feel.

Every monster has extensive fluff including Description, Lore, Ecology plus Adventure and Loot ideas.

Each download also contains Paper Mini Designs and VTT Tokens of the monster.

boardgame.name: Creature Feature Quarterly Volume 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

13 new monsters with an OSR feel.

Every monster has extensive fluff including Description, Lore, Ecology plus Adventure and Loot ideas.

Each download also contains Paper Mini Designs and VTT Tokens of the monster.

boardgame.name: Chaotic Spells
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spells. Miracles. Rituals. No matter what they are called, they all, it can be argued, are a way of tapping into the supernatural power of the world and use it in a way that hopefully benefits the caster. This can range from spells that cast balls of fire, to miracles that raise the dead and much more. Each spell or miracle is normally rigidly defined and the caster, at the time, has a good idea of what the effect *should* be, if not the precise details such as how much damage is done or if all the creatures limbs come back with it.

A Chaotic Spell, on the other hand, is one in which the caster has NO idea what will happen. The spell could be a short-range healing spell or a meters wide wall of ice.

This PDF gives you a system-neutral set of tables for generating random, or chaotic spells. You can use it to make fully chaotic spells or just one aspect of a regular spell. Some may be practically unusable, and others over-powered to the point of ridiculousness. Use them at your peril...and let chaos reign!

boardgame.name: 100 Wizardry College Students
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 1 page random roll list provides 100 different students of a magical college for the wizardry arts. Included in each entry is a first name and surname, gender, brief physical/personality descriptive, and the student’s particular discipline/focused study.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 35
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: Feuds & Favors
boardgame.description:
Feuds & Favors is a medieval-themed, turn-based, strategy card game featuring rival clans that are all competing for the title "The Paramount Legion"; the most respected title in the kingdom. Players use stacks of cards, called companies, as their legion.

On their turn, players must choose a series of 2 or 3 actions to further their cause. They can make an optional opening move but must make a positioning action followed by a main action.

Players can battle with each other by choosing one of their cards to bring into combat with an opponent's. They can also gain permanent and temporary bonuses through quests and influential figures. A player may even lay cards that affect a battle when they are not a part of it.

There are two ways to win: Victory by collection of trophies (similar to victory points) or by survival (think last man standing).

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Battlemap Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Dungeon is 27x28 in 70 pixels per inch.

User summary:

An electronic image for online play.

boardgame.name: Battlemap River Crossing
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap River Crossing is 48x34 in 70 pixels per inch.

User summary:

An electronic image for online play.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Chess Battle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Chess Battle is 20x25 in 70 pixels per inch.

User summary:

An electronic image for online play.

boardgame.name: Kitara: Les Héros tribaux
Kitara: New Heroes
boardgame.description: 9 new heroes to complete your army

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)

Publisher's blurb:

The May 21, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The May 28, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Ruined Underwater Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Different schools of fish dart between ancient pillars and colourful growths of coral in this ruined underwater temple. Seaweeds sway in the water’s currents, sticking to the intricately tiled floor and walls.
Light dances across the floor, highlighting the darkness in the hole between levels. Sharks swim down there, amidst the shadows and sand. What are they guarding?

boardgame.name: The Valley of Karaccia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This module gives a brief overview of the eponymous valley, details the town of Brink, and provides two beginner adventures for characters of levels 1-2. The Crimson Caverns is a classic, basic jaunt into kobold-infested caverns meant to help teach new players the basics of OSR-style gaming. This is followed by Fallsbarrow, a much more challenging adventure, in which the heroes are tasked by the local church to recover a relic from the nearby crypts in order to save the life of a beloved member of the community.

boardgame.name: Ancestral Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The bundle features an Ancestral Dungeon in a snowy landscape. It includes 5 map sections of the dungeon and a close up view of the camp.

boardgame.name: DRMR15
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You play the role of DRMR15 (Dreamer 15), a test subject in an experimental mind therapy. This unique solo RPG uses a standard deck of cards and any image search engine to provide a narrative and strategic gaming experience.

boardgame.name: Mussel Madness in the Great Lakes
boardgame.description:
You must help your Lake survive several waves of Mussel Invasion. Mussels eat your Phytos. The more Phytos you have, the more Fish Bucks you can earn. The Lake with the most Fish Bucks wins, except that if any Lake loses, no one can win.

This is a roll and move game where the spaces determine what happens in your lake; specifically, the phytoplankton (phytos), mussels, and algae balance. Phytos are the good guys. Mussels eat the phytos and therefore allow the algae to grow with the increased sunlight. If there is algae in your lake, the phytos can't multiply, but the mussels will. Players can earn Fish Bucks through card actions which can then be used to clean up the algae and mussels, but as with most environmental issues, funding is hard to come by!

After a predetermined number of trips around the board (years), everyone loses if anyone's lake is devoid of phytos. If everyone still has phytos left, then one winner is determined by a point system, and the player with the healthiest Great Lake is the winner!

boardgame.name: Shuffle: Star Wars Rebels
boardgame.description:
“The Empire are hunting down the Rebels who are hiding out across planet Lothal.”

The aim of the game is to capture and control Territories, by winning battles as the Rebels or as the Empire. The character card(s) played with the highest total power score capture the Territory to win a round. Matching skills with the Territory's properties increases the total power score.

The first in a 2-player or 2-team game to capture four Territories wins the game.

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Godtear: Maxen, the Artificer & Gearhawks
boardgame.description:
Unleash the firestorm with Maxen, the Artificer.

Possessed of a brilliant mind, Maxen easily grasps concepts beyond mortal understanding. Proof can be seen in his flock of mechanical Gearhawks. These helpful clockwork creatures perform tasks and may even be used as ammunition, in a pinch.

Inside this box is everything you need to add the Slayer champion Maxen, the Artificer, to your Godtear warband. Use this expansion with any Godtear starter set.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Zaka
boardgame.description:
Zaka is a light-hearted strategy card game set in a magical and monster-filled realm called "Zaka". In this game, players each build an army of whimsical monsters and then battle their way to victory using their monsters’ unique abilities and a hoard of dangerous weapons.

This fully self-contained game provides an intuitively easy-to-learn and party-ready spin on the classic genre of fantasy battle card games. To play, each player collects monster cards, upgrades them with compatible weapon cards, then uses their available special abilities to destroy enemy threats and take control of the battlefield. But players must plan their moves carefully to maximise their loot without attracting the wrath of opponent monster armies!

Designed to encourage lots of cheeky player interaction and treachery, this game suits both skilled strategists and first-time gamers alike.'

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Boten des Todes
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Bringers of Death
boardgame.description:
Death stalks the Bloodwind Spoil. Nagash’s gaze turns towards this nightmare realm of slaughter and butchery, and he sends his midnight armies to claim the souls that he believes are rightfully his. Perhaps smaller warbands will succeed where his invasion has failed. Even now they chip away at the domains of the living with the cold patience of the grave, taking what land they can and replacing the madness with the unmoving, unchanging, unfeeling calm of the dead – in the name of the Great Necromancer.

Bringers of Death is the essential guide to commanding the forces of Grand Alliance: Death in games of Warcry. Four large warbands are detailed in full, from the ethereal Nighthaunt to the disciplined Ossiarch Bonereapers. You’ll find loads of new fighter cards, background tables, Fated Quests, and Challenge Battles – in short, everything you need to play the forces of Death in full campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:


Full rules for the following warbands: Flesh-eater Courts, Legions of Nagash, Nighthaunt, and Ossiarch Bonereapers.
Fighter cards for nearly every model available to the Grand Alliance: Death ranges.
Rules for two Monsters of Death: Terrorgheists and Zombie Dragons.
Refined rules to include Monsters in your warband, as well as new abilities to use against them!
New rules for warbands with mixed Faction Runemarks under the same Grand Alliance and more than one Leader.
Tables for warrior names, warband origins, and leader backgrounds.
4 Death Fated Quests, including Spoils of Victory tables for both Honour and Glory.
6 Death Challenge Battles, including special rules and valuable Spoils.


If you feel compelled to collect the souls of the Eightpoints in the name of Nagash, this 64-page softback book is for you.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Core Book

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Bactoviral Research Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Summer Season Promo 2021 of FryxGames, which you can buy on it's own, or get for free if you order a certain amount at their webstore.

Bactoviral Research

It's a green card with a cost of 10 M€. It has a science- and microbe-tag.

Effect: Draw 1 card. Choose one of your played cards and add 1 microbe to it for each science tag you have, including this one.

Promo card X35

NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

English edition
Payment with Paypal or European Bank transfer (IBAN)
Brand new unused.
Post to UK: £1

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Harbringers of Destruction
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Sendboten der Zerstörung
boardgame.description:
Nowhere is safe from the ravages of the bestial warriors of Gorkamorka, not even the domain of the Everchosen. The din of battle that echoes throughout the Bloodwind Spoil draws orruks, ogors, and grots like moths to a flame. Here, the strong survive, and the weak are but prey. Savage warbands fight anyone they can find to prove themselves the meanest and toughest of all – and because it fills their brutal hearts with joy.

Harbingers of Destruction is the essential guide to commanding the forces of Grand Alliance: Destruction in games of Warcry. Four large warbands are detailed in full, from the diminutive Gloomspite Gitz to the hulking Ogor Mawtribes. You’ll find loads of new fighter cards, background tables, Fated Quests, and Challenge Battles – in short, everything you need to play the forces of Destruction in full campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:

Full rules for the following warbands: Bonesplitterz, Ironjawz, Gloomspite Gitz, and Ogor Mawtribes.
Fighter cards for nearly every model available to the Grand Alliance: Destruction ranges.
Rules for three Monsters of Destruction: The Aleguzzler Gargant, the Skitterstrand Arachnarok, and the Dankhold Troggoth.
Refined rules to include Monsters in your warband, as well as new abilities to use against them!
New rules for warbands with mixed Faction Runemarks under the same Grand Alliance and more than one Leader.
Tables for warrior names, warband origins, and leader backgrounds.
4 Destruction Fated Quests, including Spoils of Victory tables for both Honour and Glory.
6 Destruction Challenge Battles, including special rules and valuable Spoils.


If you want to raise your voice in a throaty bellow and get stuck in, this 64-page softback book is for you.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Catacombs
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Core Book

boardgame.name: Carry On: Drafting Card Game
boardgame.description:
Carry On is a drafting game where players pick a card to pack and passes the rest on. The heavier items you pack the more points you accumulate, but be sure to stay within your luggage limit or pay an excess baggage fee.

A game of Carry On consists of 3 rounds and the player who collects the most points win. Players assume the roles of different characters and can accumulate bonus points by collecting specific cards. There are 4 different types of Basic Item cards that players can choose from: Clothing; Document; Gadget; and Hygiene cards. Collect one of each Basic Item cards and receive extra points. You can also collect souvenir cards along the way, upgrade your luggage limit, or simply pack some carry on.

Watch out! there’s a catch. Players do not know how much they can pack until it’s too late.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Die lustige Reise um die Welt
boardgame.description:
The players roll the dice and move their game piece over a network of paths to collect six different pieces each. These are initially face down and you should remember the ones that another player was not allowed to take. The first player to return to the starting field with 6 different pieces wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dungeon Care
boardgame.description:
In the absence of the Villains, an ancient dungeon is the place where "Dungeon Care", a mysterious organisation, provides special services. They gather the children of the Villains, little Villennials, so they can safely await their parents' return, and at the same time do not break out to the surface to wreak havoc and destruction...

You will play as a brave Adventurer who will descend deep into these dungeons with a special task - take the role of a caretaker of this place, who survives until the next dawn and won't hurt any of the monsters inside!

Occasional looting of the dungeon is accepted.

The little Villennials, however, will not make things easy for you. They will set traps and throw a variety of challenges at you. Their pets will try to tear you up, and their dark moods will threaten your mental health.

Your role is to be patient and not get stuffed. The good part is, that the energy and ideas of the little Villennials are not limitless. At some point they will simply fall asleep...

On the other hand, if your entire party will drop dead from exhaustion or lose their temper, thus falling into a berzerk - your career and adventure in Dungeon Care will be over...

Throughout the game, players will play their individual skill and equipment cards together with those found while searching the dungeons in an attempt to overcome the Challenge cards posed by the little Villennials. The key is to keep your Endurance and Patience stats up while trying to avoid stacking the Dark Mood tokens on the Villennials cards. The game ends when the deck of Challenge cards is exhausted and if any of the Adventurers are conscious - they are victorious!

Dungeon Care is a 1-4 player, fast paced, cooperative fantasy card game. It gives you a mixture of classic RPG's, semi-cooperative competition and crazy party game.

The game offers different gameplay modes such as: freelance (solo mode), one-night adventure (default game scenario) or corporate career (kind of campaign with the character development and expanding dungeon).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Happy Shell Farmer
boardgame.description:
An Australian board game from the 1920's that depicts rural Australia farming life and advertises Shell oils and lubricants.

Players start at a homestead in the center of the board and follow a path that passes various farming activities such as ploughing, milking, harvesting and shearing before returning to home. Each Farming task is accompanied with advice on which Shell oil or lubricant is needed.

Players move by spin of a teetotum and if a player lands on a red square he must detour to one of the farming activities, after they reach the activity they return to the main path and continue with the spin of the teetotum. The player to reach home (square 100) by exact count is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Enigma: Crime Scene
boardgame.description:
Enigma: Crime Scene is a replayable crime investigation game that can be competitively, cooperatively or imposter mode.

Players attempt to pinpoint the criminal from 10 suspects using a variety of tools including newspapers, riddle cards, maps, fingerprint cards and more. The base games comes with 4 scenarios set in London, New York, Chicago, and Sicily. 3 cards (location, weapon, and fingerprints) are placed face down on the board.

The first person to combine the location, weapon and fingerprints clues and find the criminal, wins the game.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Constructo Quiz
boardgame.description:
The players have to guess a word secretly written down by the game leader based on information about individual letters. The earlier you give a correct guess, the more points you get. Mistakes are penalized with a point deduction. After an agreed number of words, the game leader is changed. Whoever has the most points at the end wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Krigsspelet
boardgame.description:
A conflict resolution card game with a lot of silly humour. Created by 13 and 15 year old Dan and Claes Lindman during a summer holiday and then published by Swedens national umbrella organisation for gaming clubs, SVEROK.

The game is a easy conflict resolution card game played with one six sided dice (D6). Rules are simple and swift with additional rules very specific to each card.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Deckel drauf
boardgame.description:
On a 3x3 board with 9 numbered squares, the goal is to win rounds by covering the most squares with tiles. First, 9 of a player's 27 pieces are randomly placed on the squares at the same time. Then the players take turns to draw 2 pieces each from the bag and place them one after the other in the squares 1-9. Then the players take turns, there are two possibilities: Either move one of your own stones as you wish, or cover a square in which there are exactly 5 of your own stones, no matter how many opposing stones are in it. If no more fields can be covered, the game ends, whoever has covered more fields wins the round, with 3 won rounds you win the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: SEN: Seven Eight Nine
boardgame.description:
SEN is a minimalistic zen puzzle game about recognising patterns of numbers, colours and shapes.

The rules of the game are taught with absolutely zero instruction - the progression and design of the levels has been carefully balanced to introduce each rule, thereby giving players the sensation of discovering the rules for themselves.

Featuring easy to learn rules that are difficult to master, different game modes, and a beautifully relaxing soundtrack.

~Nintendo.com description

boardgame.name: Player's Journal
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

160 page journal including five 32 page sections consisting of a Character sheet, House sheet, and themed blank, lined and squared pages with intricate patterns letting you record your epic stories in the Dune: Adventures in the Imperium roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Dune Roleplaying Dice Sets
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

A beautiful set of custom dice, spot wormsign on these sand coloured dice and bring the power of the Makers to your Dune: Adventures in the Imperium game.

Pack contains five twenty-sided dice.

Coloured in sand yellow with brown rock marbling and cinnamon numbering.

Each dice carries a custom symbol of Shai-Hulud on one face.

boardgame.name: Pez a la Vista
boardgame.description:
The beautiful Tiwiimi River is home to the greatest fish. On its shores, various tribes compete with their handmade boats in a fierce annual competition. The tribe that catches the most fish gains prestige and honor. This time you will lead the expedition to the river so get ready and manage your boats as best you can to get as many points as possible.

During his turn, the player must risk taking out boats to have more options to fish. After a few decks you choose a fish card, and place it in the river to gain points and resources. Then the fishing phase follows where you activate your boats and use the resources to catch fish and earn more victory points. After this, the purchase phase follows where you acquire boats to improve the deck and catch a greater number of fish.

The game ends when the four decks have the same number of players or less and the winner is the one with the highest score among their ships of the same color and tokens.

—description from publisher



El hermoso río tiwiimi alberga los más grandiosos peces y en sus orillas diversas tribus pesqueras que con sus barcos hechos artesanalmente se baten en una feroz competencia anual, por tanto, la tribu que atrapa más peces gana prestigio y honor, esta vez tú lideraras la expedición al río así que prepárate y gestiona lo mejor posible tus embarcaciones logrando obtener la mayor cantidad de puntos posibles.

boardgame.name: Post-Apocalyptic Factory Base
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 30 inch Battlemap of a Post-Apocalyptic Factory Base. It has Hex, Square and No Overlays; it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“Why work to farm this blasted landscape when you can just loot from others? The looters are set up in an old factory they have converted into a base. They steal our food and water at gunpoint whenever they need more supplies. Is there anything you can do to help us, strangers?”—Farmer

Post-Apocalyptic Factory Base includes a single exterior map of an industrial or chemical factory that has been converted into a base of operations by its occupants. Concrete walls surround the base. The southern gate is surrounded by two guard towers on a concrete walkway. A crashed bus is used as a walkway between the yard and the roof of the factory offering excellent vantage points for sniper guards on the roof.

Post-Apocalyptic Factory Base is intended for use in modern post-apocalyptic games. It could also be used as a lair for a supervillain in a modern super game. A supervillain who can manipulate metal, chemicals, or water could use the scrap or vats to their advantage. A super strong villain could throw buses, cargo containers, and other scrap on the map.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Looter Base at the Old Factory: Farmers have asked the group to put an end to looters at an old factory who are stealing their food and water. The factory is well-defended with two guard towers at the southern front gate and snipers on the factory roof looking out for those approaching from other directions. The looters may be using the scrap around the factory to make weapons, armor, and ammo. They could also be using chemicals from vats to make drugs. Does the group decide to kill the looters for the farmers? Or do they decide to try to trade with them or even try to join them instead?

boardgame.name: The Sacred Temple of Erwadu
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The great ziggurat temple dedicated to the god, Enki, towers majestically over the marshes that cluster along the banks of the broad river delta. No one knows what exactly lies behind its mudbrick walls. Surely vast treasures fill its fresco-lined chambers, and doubtlessly terrible guardians keep the unworthy from claiming them.

DDS1 The Sacred Temple of Erwadu is a classic-style fantasy RPG module for characters levels 7 to 10. It is designed specifically for the 1st edition of the original and everyone’s favorite fantasy role-playing game. This module has a minimal plot involving of high adventure, sorcery, and mystery that allows it to fit easily into any campaign world. It can easily be adapted to most fantasy role-playing games, including the advanced 2nd edition game, the original game, the BECMI (“Basic”) game, most old-school renaissance (OSR) role-playing systems, and most other similar game systems.

In this adventure, inspired by the mythology and culture of the ancient Sumerians, the players explore a ziggurat located in marshy river delta. The characters must survive the four deadly levels of the temple to escape its mudbrick walls. This adventure contains background notes, a cutaway map of the temple, five new monsters, and six variable endings. Additionally, this special module contains original thirteen illustrations to show the players. The referee can opt to play this module one of two ways — as a ‘Living’ or, ‘Lost’ temple.

boardgame.name: Secret of the Silver Spire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rumors speak of a mysterious silver tower that shines like a polished mirror that has recently appeared out of thin air. Bizarre creatures believed to have emerged from the tower roam the land. The few learned sages that know of it suggest that the tower is really a dimension-hopping fortress. Possibly some adventurers could go to the tower to find out why it has come here?

DD4 Secret of the Silver Spire is classic-style fantasy RPG module for characters levels 3 to 7. It is designed specifically for the 1st edition of the original and everyone’s favorite fantasy role-playing game. This module has a minimal plot involving of high adventure, sorcery, and mystery that allows it to fit easily into any campaign world. It can easily be adapted to most fantasy role-playing games, including the advanced 2nd edition game, the original game, the BECMI (“Basic”) game, most old-school renaissance (OSR) role-playing systems, and most other similar game systems.

In this adventure, the player characters explore an outlandish citadel inhabited by strange creatures, such as the barzani ape-men, modrons of many types, and three-faced golden sentinels. The enigmatic overlords are the "silver masters" — alien beings made of pure energy. The tower is a maze of rooms stuffed with strange equipment and curious items these creatures have collected from all over the multiverse.

boardgame.name: Stellar Empire: Skirmish
boardgame.description:
Stellar Empire is a 15 minute 2 player strategic card game, requiring critical thinking and clever bluffing.

You take the role of a fleet admiral, and your goal is to capture as many planets along your stellar border as you can with the expedition fleet at your disposal. Some planets along the border are more ideal than others, but even a barren rock can be mined for resources. You will lead either the Royal Expedition Force of the Wami Kingdom, or the 3rd Fleet of the Neupert Prefecture.

Each turn, the opposing fleets engage over one of the contested planets, and players select a vessel to engage. As the more powerful ship prevails, the system will join the victors stellar empire. If the ships fight to a draw, as they skulk away to lick their wounds, the following battles become more important, as the victor of the next battle will be able to lay claim to each system where combat was unresolved.

Once both players have exhausted their entire fleet, cooler heads will prevail and an armistice will be signed.

While both stellar empires may have made territorial claims, only the empire with the more worthwhile conquest can justify the skirmish and be called the victor!

boardgame.name: Ghoul
Liber Genus XI: Ghoul
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever looked at a creature and thought, "hmm, that would be interesting to play"? Have you thought it a shame that some creatures look like you could walk down the street in your game as one yet there are no hard rules on how to do that? Well the Liber Genus series aims to fill that niche.

This eleventh installment brings the cannibalistic ghouls to the table, with rules on how to create a character as a versatile ancestry as well as an archetype anyone can take. Incorporating one versatile heritage, one dedication as well as 10 feats shared between the ancestry and archetype, including two magical items.

boardgame.name: Olde Swords Reign Expansion II: Monsters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Expansion II for Olde Swords Reign contains over 70 new monsters, from Ankheg to Yeti.

Olde Swords Reign is a complete roleplaying game based on 5e and the original 1974 game and supplements.

boardgame.name: Volant
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

StarCluster 4 - Volant is a game set on a magical post-apocalyptic world, where no human has magic, but the animals, plants, and the stones are full of it. The surface of the world is full of monsters, and only scattered nomads live there. Civilization is only possible in the skylands - floating islands in the sky. Ships made of floating stone fly between them, and riders of giant birds and bats make war in the air and explore the surface.

boardgame.name: Remarkable Lineages: Dagari
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Upon the face of the land was chaos and death, but on the winds rode Kazenglaze and his people. They fed us. They healed us. And they made what was broken by the wolves of the sea and the jackals of the courts whole again. They are dagari. They are the honorable ones.”
— Lucious Frowl, sage of the Costal Highlands

From the cliffs of the Razorback Ridge to their capital of BaDagar, the dagari keep guard along the rocky shorelines of the Costal Highlands—their kingdom and homeland—patrolling for pirates and safeguarding the people who live under their banner. Gliding through the cool, salty air of the Highlands, the dagari seek to live in ways that honor their ever-watching ancestors and bring personal glory to their fold.

This supplement includes:

Stats for the playable lineage, the Dagari.
Details about their cultural philosophy, strict code of honor, and ancestral reverence.
Lore and trivia for you to use when roleplaying your Dagari character.
A new fighting style developed by these winged warriors.
A new martial archetype, the Fold Vanguard.
A new sacred oath, the Oath of the Ancestors.

boardgame.name: Infinite Kowloon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’ve made a mistake.

You went somewhere no one goes. You opened the “employees only” door. You cried yourself to sleep on the bench of a forgotten bus stop. You closed dying eyes in a blood-soaked nightclub bathroom. You ran away from home and took a midnight subway ride in utter solitude. And now you’re here. You’re in the place where all the truly missing people go. You’re a face on the back of a milk carton, staring longingly at the normal world with a monochromatic rictus grin. You’re the nameless victim of an urban legend. You’re in the hell of neon and blood.

You’re in Infinite Kowloon.


Infinite Kowloon is a combination OSR ruleset and setting of Urban Fantasy Horror. Imagine being lost in an unknown city late at night. Imagine your attempts to find refuge and familiarity are thwarted by twisted mockeries of what you are looking for. Imagine that city, the very concrete and asphalt, the glittering glass towers and dark alleys, every twisted urban legend hiding in its shadows, was alive and cruel. It hates you. It is god here. And it is infinite.

Eke out survival within this unending urban sprawl, a modern mega-dungeon where all the accomplishments of humanity are turned against them. Find your way back to the mundane world, or lose your sanity and become part of this one.

Features

Simple OSR ruleset based on the Black Hack 2.0
Modified Class system called "Types" which gives players a place to start but does not restrict their growth or the roles they wish to play
Unique magic system: Schools of Neon, Chrome, Steel, Blood, and Smoke allow players to summon dancing neon ghosts, overclock their own flesh, and suffocate enemies with smog. *All spells are physical objects found in the world, and are single use unless a price is paid.
This City will change you: Fight against the corrupting influence of the city. Death won't stop you, but you will come back different. Leveling up grants not simply numerical changes, but physical ones as well. The longer you are here, the more you will change, and the closer you'll be to losing yourself to the City.
Extensive setting information including 30 spells, 30 diseases, drugs, and poisons, 60+ starting items, over a dozen unique enemies, roll charts for Corruption, Influence, and locations, example maps, and instructions for creating more of the Infinite City.

boardgame.name: Outlander: The Series – The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Step through the stones of Craigh na Dun and run through the Scottish Highlands with the handsome Jamie. The year is 1743, and the outlaw James Fraser is at your side as you navigate the thrills and dangers of the Highlands. Use your wit, reach the right locations, make the right friends, and gather the items you need, all while keeping Jamie out of the hands of the many who would do him wrong. The gallows await fair Jamie (or worse!) should you fail. Fulfill your destiny and win his heart, only then will victory be yours!

Players select an Event scenario to fulfill. During turns, players can bid to gain cards, move meeples, or reduce Danger. As Jamie moves about the board, he may encounter any of three enemies: The Watch, The Red Coats, and Black Jack Randall. If Jamie should encounter an enemy with no means of escape, the Event is failed and the game is lost for every player. As a co-operative game, every player aims to fulfill the Event in play to win the game. Competitively, the player who has gained the most Favour from Jamie wins his heart and is the true winner of the game. The game ends when all of the conditions in the Event are fulfilled, or if Jamie is captured. Once the event conditions are fulfilled, the player who has acquired the most Favour from Jamie wins the game.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Shambles by Day
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

About The Shambles by Day

Languard is the Duchy of Ashlar’s capital city. It is a vibrant, dynamic place full of opportunities, complications and adventures. So often, though, characters moving about the city experience none of this rich flavour—they simply arrive at their destination.

Use the lists herein to add depth and flavour to your characters’ exploration of the Shambles in Languard (or the slum district of any fantasy town or city)

Even the smallest town has more locations than all but the most diligent and time-rich GM could ever hope to detail and design. To make matters even worse, when an adventuring party gets to a town or city, the characters often have the irritating habit of going off exploring. What’s a GM to do? Designed specifically for you, the busy GM, the mini-eventures herein help you bring depth and flavour to your characters’ next urban adventure. This compilation is designed for use with City Backdrop: Languard, but can be easily used in virtually any town or city.

boardgame.name: Miscellaneous Decorations (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the walls in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Miscellanous Decorations is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Miscellaneous Decorations (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the walls in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Miscellanous Decorations is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Miscellaneous Decorations (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the walls in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Miscellanous Decorations is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Miscellaneous Decorations (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the walls in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Miscellanous Decorations is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: 2020: The Best Year Ever
boardgame.description:
2020: The Best Year Ever (The Game) is a “2020 themed” board game. It cleverly uses the events of 2020 to draw players together based on their common experience of the year. “Play cards” encourage players to “act out” common (and their own) 2020 experiences while “Point cards” memorialize well known AND little known events of 2020 while helping OR hurting a player’s “score.” Using unconventional (and fluid) game rules, players are kept involved and “off balance” (much like we all were during 2020) as each game unfolds differently depending on the cards drawn.

2020: The Best Year Ever (The Game) uses dice, a spinner, and unique cards hat guide players through 2020 related challenges, activities and conversations while players collect (plus and minus) points until the games ends - at any moment - in one of several possible ways. The player with the highest points at the end wins.

boardgame.name: The Druid
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new character class for There Once Were Dragons, the roleplaying game of epic fantasy action!

Eschewing long studies and theoretical experiments, a Druid develops his raw arcane talent by seeking the magic that can be found in every part of the natural world. His almost perfect attunement to the primal realm of wind, tree and beast can make his seem aloof and distant more often than not. Those who dismiss him as nothing more than a flower child will soon regret this, for he is not only an unparalleled healer but also a master of shapes and spirits.

Summon powerful natural spirits to do your bidding.
Buff your allies to turn them into veritable killing machines. And since all machines break down, you can also heal them and even bring them back from the brink of death.
If healing and summoning gets too boring, you can always unleash the fury of nature on your enemies or transform into a powerful beast to meet them face to face.


Flower power takes a whole new meaning with a greater earth elemental on your side!

boardgame.name: The Martyr of War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blessed Doom That Walks: The Martyr of War is a system-agnostic compendium containing one in a series of seven demigods for use with RPGs. The Martyr of War is inspired by the KULT: Divinity Lost RPG and the novel Johnny Got His Gun by Dalton Trumbo and works best in the context of fantasy, or a comparative setting to European medieval to early 18th century technology and culture.

boardgame.name: Berserker Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The new Berserker Class for Labyrinth Lord includes the following:

Class Details;

The following Berserker abilities and skills:
Berserker State;
Grants bonuses to hit or additional attacks per round;
Grants bonuses to unarmored armor class;
Enables the berserker to fight beyond normal physical capacity or even death!
Fearlessness;
Magical Transformation;
Human berserkers can transform into animals, including at higher levels man-beasts and giant-sized beasts;
Dwarf and gnome berserkers can grow to the size and power of ogres and giants, at the highest levels even to the size and power of titans!

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #30 - Jun 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 80 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues (info on submitting is found inside each issue).

Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #30:


Bexim's Bazaar Pages

Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards
Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month
The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks
Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors
Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month
Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost
Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month
Plovin's Rare Documents - each month, a new eldritchd document prop to print for players
Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC
Deed - new printable prop each month related to owning property


The Skirmish Table Pages

Hazel’s Weapons Emporium - Seller of the best (unofficial) weapons and accessories for Gaslands
Frostgrave Scenario - Bonebreaker
The Derelict Solo Campaign Part 2 of 5 - scenario for Stargrave


GM Resources Pages

A Swift Survey - A 5e mini-adventure and hand-made map from Bryan Swift
Adventure a Week - a fantasy RPG mini adventure
Kev’s Lounge Paper Miniatures - two paper miniatures to print and make for your game
DM Scotty's Wandering Monster - 2 new 5e Monsters
Dungeon Tiles Sample - 3 printable sample dungeon tiles


The Crafting Table Pages

Craft Your Own Dungoen Tiles - Crafting How-To article
Depths of the Drow - Papercraft project from Fat Dragon Games

boardgame.name: Destiny of Tides: Mer-May Special 2021
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even more treasures for your undersea adventures!

The Destiny of Tides Mer-May Special 2021 brings you more expanded content for Tiny Dungeon 2e’s first full campaign setting. In addition to collecting all the expanded Destiny of Tide options from Tiny Compendiums 2018 and 2019, this zine also provides all-new one page dungeons and special tribe generation rules, including special favors the tribe can grant for their champions.

Generate the undersea peoples your adventurers champion and garner their favor
Discover the secrets of the Undertide Relics
Unleash waves of new creatures, including the “Dire Orca” and the terrifying Xiphopteryx!
Explore the two levels of the Fallen Temple, or claim the treasures of the Shattered Keep
Make your way through the twisted brinicle web and avoid its frosty guardian in “Caged-In,” a plug-in encounter to challenge your adventurers

boardgame.name: Motif
boardgame.description:
Two players, three sides. Six pawns, no dice. Are you ready to turn fate into your favor?

Motif is a game with one objective: occupy more squares than your opponent. It is a head-to-head board game comprised of simple rules and brilliant tactics.

Players attempt to control the largest area on a 5 x 5 grid board using zone of control tactics. Each piece added to the board affects all the other pieces of the same color so careful placement is the key to winning the most squares and the game.

Motif always begins with an empty board — no pawns, all white squares.

On each turn:


Add a new pawn to any square that is reachable by your existing pawns if any.
Move your other pawns on the board. Relocate all of them if possible. Pawns can freely maneuver around other pawns in complicated trails. Diagonals and jumps are prohibited.
Turn squares into the same color as the pawn that lands on it. Pawns always leave a mark.
Play until all the squares are occupied.


The player with the most squares in their color wins.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Fire Quintessence
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This game supplement covers the Fire Tamer class and its Five Burning Paths "War, Destruction, Cauterization, Elemental Self and Ashes". Each Burning path can be taken as a feat to add fire powers to any other class as well. 5e and HexagonRPG compatible rules included.

boardgame.name: Seven Stones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seven Stones takes us to a desperate settlement, living in terror of a dreadful monster. The village lies on a rocky peninsula blasted by frigid winds, and here, people have lived in fear of the Stoor Wurm for generations…

Written by Elaine Lithgow, and with art from Jon Hodgson, Paul Bourne and Scott Purdy, Seven Stones provides a wealth of NPCs to meet, locations to explore and adversaries to battle. At 33 pages long, illustrated in full colour, it comes with VTT battle maps and tokens so that if you can’t play in person, you can play on the virtual tabletop of choice.

With an open-ended finale, it really is up to the player to solve the mystery of what is going on at The Spearhead and determine how best to resolve it.

boardgame.name: Polarity
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the ruler of Daxolo died and his heir proved to be unfit to rule, the political situation has devolved into legions of strongmen fighting one another for the chance to rule, and looking for any edge that can help them. One of them has taken to gathering subjects — willing and otherwise — for an experiment designed to give him that edge. But one of his abductees draws the heroes into the situation, where they find themselves facing a perfect combination of ambition, madness, and violence, and which might prove too much for them to handle.

Polarity is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Lost in Translation?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There was little I could do to help Berlin talk to the shopkeeper, so I simply hung in the background letting them talk and casually looking around the merchant’s small shop. We were there to negotiate for a rare synthorganic axion assembly. We were told this merchant had several, but he spoke little Common, and the difficult local language even had Berlin making several stumbles.

Negotiations seemed to be proceeding smoothly, so I busied myself with watching the installation procedure on my hand computer. Suddenly, an annoyed grunt was followed quickly by Berlin’s “Wait…uh…” I looked up at Berlin’s uncharacteristic stammer. The merchant suddenly looked angry. Berlin was stammering, trying to regain some semblance of confidence and social advantage. He stole a nervous glance in my direction. I met his gaze with a “what the hell?” look.

“I think I just insulted his mother,” he hissed.

As if in response to Berlin’s aside, the merchant drew two curved knives from his tunic and stalked slowly forward, spitting something in his language through gritted teeth. I didn’t need to know what he said…I picked up on how he said it.

Most starfarers would agree that jaunting among the stars can be dangerous, not only from the usual hazards like hard vacuum and harder radiation, but from seemingly little things like miscommunication. One mistaken word or gesture and a trade negotiation can suddenly become a desperate fight for survival.

Multiple languages obviously presents communication problems if there’s no way to translate between them. Fortunately for the interstellar government (and the Players), solutions have been put in place to help.

This supplement for Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game gives the Referee a chance to introduce a little more complexity — and by extension, realism — into his or her universe by modifying one way the heroes interact with others.

Lost in Translation? Adventure is the universal language.

boardgame.name: Quadzzles
boardgame.description:
The six 1.5-inch cubes are lasercut from white wooden hardboard. They are sent unassembled in 36 pieces. Simply friction-fit the sides together into six cubes and you are ready to play.
Roll or shuffle the cubes and place randomly in the tray. Use one letter from adjacent (top) “quads” to make words of at least three letters, in either direction. Words can start anywhere. Write down all your words.

After three minutes, compare all words to opponents’ words. Remove duplicates and illegal words. Score only the unique words, one point per letter. The player with the highest score wins.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Relics of Rajavihara: Montalo's Revenge
boardgame.description:
Returning to Cambodia after receiving a mysterious letter detailing Professor Montalo’s previous theft of the powerful Seer Stone, you find yourself in a trap set by his vengeful son, Arioch.

He has created an even more dangerous set of traps than you faced previously. So, this is Montalo’s revenge…

30 new levels. 3 additional new elements.

Are you up for the challenge?

boardgame.name: Epic Zoo
boardgame.description:
EPIC ZOO is a new project which focuses on creating a zoo with fantastic animals, with a quick dynamic to learn that does not include violence in its mechanics, which makes EPIC ZOO the ideal game for all audiences.

EPIC ZOO is a game in which you must plan your expansion strategy and overcome obstacles.

boardgame.name: Eurasia (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description:
The map is (geographically) large but there are actually less tracks overall than the US map. There are slightly more single routes but many less double routes (and less than I intended when I started this). After playing a few more 4 and 5 player games, some players in our group have expressed the wish that we use stations with this map as well, because some of the destinations may become hard to reach even with 4 players.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: A Wee Bit Twisted (Issue 1 - Summer 2019)
boardgame.description:
publsiher blurb

Welcome to the inaugural issue of Wee Bit Twisted, a ‘zine dedicated to the casual role playing gamer. Featuring a complete one-shot adventure which can be played using the included RPG system or adapted for use with the gamer’s favorite D20 or D100 systems.

Within the 26 pages of the 'zine you will find unique objects, maps, fully detailed locations, and NPC descriptions for the one-shot.
boardgame.rpgissue: Dr Zero Presents: A Wee Bit Twisted

boardgame.name: A Wee Bit Twisted (Issue 2 - Summer 2021)
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
During a sudden thunder storm, the players stumble upon a ruined tower with a mysterious past. Can they uncover the secrets of the mysterious Faithless Servant, the Libertine Son of the old Duke, and the tower itself?

Welcome to the second issue of Wee Bit Twisted featuring a one-shot adventure to be played in a single session; it's the perfect stand-alone evening of absurd mayhem for the casual gamer or a little action zest to add to an existing campaign. It is scaled for four to five players at level two through level five.
boardgame.rpgissue: Dr Zero Presents: A Wee Bit Twisted

boardgame.name: Guessed List
boardgame.description:
A fun fast party game for all where you choose a List Title and then shout as many answers as you can in 30 seconds to try to guess a specific name on the Guessed List and win the card.

Each list contains 6 names. Roll a die to determine which of the 6 names, you will have to guess. You have 30 seconds to make a correct guess and win the card. The player who has won the most cards after 5 rounds is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Champ'd Up: Slam Down
boardgame.description:
Champ’d Up: Slam Down is a collectable card game with custom decks of cards generated by playing Champ’d Up from The Jackbox Party Pack 7. The games live in the same universe, but they’re totally different. For starters, one is a video game and one is a card game. Also, one is an 8-player party game about making funny characters and the other is a 2-player combat strategy card game.

Champ’d Up: Slam Down is a unique two-player card game where each player takes the role of a trainer battling champs against their opponent until only one player is left standing/sitting! Each turn you will recruit champs from your hand into the ring to fight your opponent’s champs. Deplete your opponent’s reserves and call them out to declare victory and win the game!

To get a pack (you only need one), play an online game of Champ’d Up in The Jackbox Party Pack 7. Create ridiculous champs and battle them for supremacy. But draw with care because these champs are going to make their way into the physical world! After your game, you can purchase a pack of Champ’d Up: Slam Down cards with the characters you created in Champ’d Up. It will be custom printed and delivered right to your door. When you receive your cards, grab a friend and play this simple but exciting take on a 1-on-1 collectable card game. Combine decks and trade cards with others for even more ridiculous mayhem.

Players will take turns until a player wins the game. The player who is taking a turn is referred to as the “active player.” At the very start of their turn, the active player gets 3 energy. On the active player's turn, they can use energy to execute a variety of actions: Recruit, Hype, Fight, use Special abilities, and Call out their Opponent. Slam Down's custom cards means a diverse variety of cards can be printed from playing Champ'd Up (in the Jackbox Party Pack 7) repeat times. Fighting is how players remove opposing champs from the ring. If the active player has a champ in the ready position and their opponent has no players in the ring, the active player can call them out. If the active player calls out an opponent with no champs in their reserve, the game ends and they win the game!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Desolation Dungeon
boardgame.description:
In Desolation Dungeon you can play as either The Dungeon master or one of the heroes.

The Dungeon Master begins the game by laying out room cards with hidden traps and monsters and rooms in a way that will hinder the Hero’s on their journey to steal your loot!!! During the hero's turn, the players can choose up to 3 separate actions to search the dungeon, fight the monsters and escape with the loot.

Play continues until the Dungeon Masters has collected 10 hero souls or there is one hero left with 12 treasure points.

The game is for 2-5 players with multiple game scenarios and a solo variant for playing by yourself as the hero. Currently the stand alone version of the game is 165 cards with one expansion of 20 cards (10 for the hero, and 10 for the Dungeon master).

—description from publisher

listing.notes: These are brand new Straight from the printer and sitting in wait for you to play!

boardgame.name: Scofflaws: A Fiasco Playset
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the near future, gig workers try to make ends meet by taking on the toughest jobs, with the help of a hacked brain implant that makes them smarter, faster and stronger for each crime they're currently committing.

boardgame.name: Штука (The Thingy)
boardgame.description:
The Thingy is a party game based on charades and searching details on paintings, each depicting a scene packed with various objects.

In Each round, one player describes the hidden item with charades, words, drawings, or yes/no questions. Other players try to find the item on the picture among hundreds of other objects and snatch the thingy first as soon as finding the answer!

The player who was the first to find the right item moves their token on the scoring board ahead. The player who reaches the end of the scoring path first, wins.

Various paintings and numerous task cards to play over and over again.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Love Letter: Princess Princess Ever After
boardgame.description:
Win the Princess' heart!

Find the perfect ally to secretly carry your letter to Princess Isadora and win her heart in Love Letter: Princess Princess Ever After, a quick game of risk and deduction based on the award-winning Love Letter card game! Entrust your message to the nearly invincible ogre, the lightning fast unicorn, or her close friends, Princess Sadie and Princess Amira!

The game includes 21 tarot-sized character cards and 13 acrylic favor tokens.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: El Ansia
Az éhség
The Hunger
Noc upírů
Od zmierzchu do świtu
더 헝거
boardgame.description:
The Hunger is a race in which each vampiric player must optimize their card deck, hunt humans to gain victory points, fulfill secret missions, and eventually acquire a rose and return to the castle before sunrise. The more you hunt, the slower both you and your deck become, which will make it harder and harder to get back before daybreak. Can you become the most notorious vampire without burning to ashes at sunrise?

During the game, players spend "speed" to move their vampires around the map, hunt humans worth victory points, and add new cards to their deck.

The game ends at dawn, after which the surviving player with the most victory points on their cards wins!

—description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 78: Luna Capital, The Hunger, Imperial Settlers, Cutterland - Top 5 Games We‘re Thankful We Don‘t Have To Play
