boardgame.name: Single Unique Power
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb
In Single Unique Power, roll dice and pull words from a pot to create an exciting world and its superpowered inhabitants!

Single Unique Power is a 23-page, cast-building, setting-creation game inspired by the “one person, one power” trope popular in superhero media, manga, and anime. Examples include mutations in X-Men, quirks in My Hero Academia, devil fruit powers in One Piece, and nen abilities in Hunter × Hunter. In each of these examples, select characters all have unique, personalized powers.

At the end of this game, you’ll have a colorful cast of characters as well as bits and pieces of their backstories. These characters can be enjoyed on their own as you collectively imagine their lives and powers, or you can carry them into future RPGs and stories.

To play Single Unique Power, you’ll need:

Two or more players
Three six-sided dice
Writing utensils
A stack of notecards (3x5” recommended)
A pot for collecting and mixing cards, such as a hat or a bowl

boardgame.name: Alien Planet Moonscape Expansion
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the Box

Shoot the Moon!

It's not just another trip to the moon! Next tiem your players are ready to explore a planet they just discovered, they won't have to wait while you draw out ever impact crater or icy outcropping. Starfinder Flip-Tiles Alien Planet Moonscape Expansion provides beautifully illustrated 6" x 6" map tiles that can be used to create the wide vistas of a cratered planetoid or an icy moon! Inside, you'll find 24 richly crafted, double-sided map tiles. This expansion set, along with Starfinder Flip-Tiles: Alien Planet Starter Set, allows you to create a variety of extraterrestrial environments for endless planetary encounters! So stop your sketching and start your flipping today!

boardgame.name: Merchants of the Dark Road: Merchant Coin Pouches
boardgame.description: Coin pouches for Merchants of the Dark Road.

boardgame.name: Solar Temple
boardgame.description:
Pubisher's Blurb

Whether the heroes are mastering the secrets of supernovas and black holes under the tutelage of a master solarian or defending mystics in the glare of a once-in-a-lifetime solar flare eruption, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every meditation room and training courtyard. Fortunately, with Paizo's latest Starfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use science-fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. This double-sided map features an ancient solarian hermitage on one side and a futuristic cloister in space on the other. Don't waste time sketching when you could be playing. With tarfinder Flip-Mat: Solar Temple, you'll be ready the next time your players seek enlightenment among the stars!

A special coating on each Flip-Mat allows you to use wet erase, dry erase, AND permanent markers with ease! Removing permanent ink is easy -- simply trace over any permanent mark with a dry erase marker, wait 10 seconds, then wipe off both marks with a dry cloth or paper towel.trace over any permanent mark with a dry erase marker, wait 10 seconds, then wipe off both marks with a dry cloth or paper towel.

boardgame.name: Crashed Starship
boardgame.description:
Pubisher's Blurb

Whether the heroes are combing through an interstellar shipwreck for valuable salvage or survivors escaping the ruins of their own demolished vessel, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every hull breach and crumpled bulkhead. Fortunately, with Paizo's latest Starfinder Flip-Mat, you don't have to! This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use science-fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master.

This double-sided map features a starship crash site and its surroundings on one side and the damaged interior of the starship on the other. Don't waste time sketching when you could be playing. With Starfinder Flip-Mat: Crashed Starship, you'll be ready the next time your players come in for a rough landing!

A special coating on each Flip-Mat allows you to use wet erase, dry erase, AND permanent markers with ease! Removing permanent ink is easy—simply trace over any permanent mark with a dry erase marker, wait 10 seconds, then wipe off both marks with a dry cloth or paper towel.

boardgame.name: My Friend Deep in the Woods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the woods, the Tragos-man prowls,
protect your children from this terrible friend,
big sun, the Tragos-man arrives,
It smiles, it chooses, forget your little ones...


Dans les bois, le Tragos-man rôde,
protégez vos enfants de ce terrible ami,
grand soleil, le Tragos-man arrive,
il sourit, il choisit, oubliez vos petits...
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Mon ami au fond de la forêt PDF
My Friend Deep in the Woods PDF

boardgame.name: Planetary Atmosphere
boardgame.description:
Pubisher's Blurb

Whether the heroes are landing their starship to explore a newly discovered world or dogfighting in the skies in individual starfighters, Paizo's latest Starfinder Flip-Mat has you covered. This line of gaming maps provides ready-to-use science-fantasy set pieces for the busy Game Master. Featuring a hex grid for Starfinder's unique starship combat system, this extra-large, double-sided map comes with two different backgrounds—the thick clouds of a gas giant and a high-altitude view of a terrestrial world's topography—to let you craft epic atmospheric starship battles and fire your players' imaginations. Don't waste time sketching when you could be playing. With Starfinder Flip-Mat: Planetary Atmosphere, you'll be ready the next time your players take their starship planetside!

A special coating on each Flip-Mat allows you to use wet erase, dry erase, AND permanent markers with ease! Removing permanent ink is easy -- simply trace over any permanent mark with a dry erase marker, wait 10 seconds, then wipe off both marks with a dry cloth or paper towel.

boardgame.name: The Killing Fields (Issue 9 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Killing Fields is a monthly 'zine. It contains reviews and articles about current and past role playing games.

Issue 9 contains an encounter for Pendragon, articles on Deadlands and MERP and a piece of fiction.

boardgame.name: Chaos Riders
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

The city lies in ruins, as it has for centuries. Only a fool would believe this can ever change! There is no going back to the olden days of gilded palaces and crowded markets, for the doom covers everything. But what of the future? Not even doom lasts forever, and not even death can conquer life until it has had its chance to live.

This city, though long destroyed, is far from lifeless. And while there seems no shortage of foolish adventurers who come here to die in search of treasure, there are others, too (far fewer in number), who come here to live. Chief among them are the knights that make up the Esoteric Order of the Riders of Chaos. They abandoned their oaths to lords and kings, and turned their backs on civilization itself, with all of its useless trappings. Now they live in the wild, just like the wild things do. But they are more than mere animals.

To join the Order, a knight must not only be physically altered by the magical nature of the ruined city and its wastelands, they must also befriend a local creature to employ as a steed. For how can one be called a knight while one walks upon the earth with one’s own two feet? Even growing new sets of legs is not enough to make one a mounted knight. But chaos riders do not keep domesticated animals for their steeds, far from it. They raise no elk nor horses in these blighted lands — instead, a chaos rider must convince another creature to carry them around. It is not enough to merely have a steed. To be a true and proper knight, you must also pay that steed a proper wage.

The most common steed among the chaos riders is the mighty land lobster. Much more intelligent than most animals, but still without language, these hard-shelled creatures lurk inside the basements and tunnels beneath the streets of Ardoussarlis. Land lobsters are equally at home underwater as they are on land, preferring freshwater lakes and rivers, but humans have named them after the place where they are most likely to be encountered. They have a surprising number of enemies and food sources in common with the knights of the Order, and so the two groups see an alliance between them as boon to both sides.

boardgame.name: Chronicles I: Roman Silver, Saxon Greed
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Chronicles, a series of modules for BARONS OF BRAUNSTEIN! Relive the hobby's old-school past with these quick and easy historical adventures...

Set in dark age (Saxon) Britain, the characters have found a strange map promising riches among the cellars of a forgotten Roman villa. But beware, for the land is wild...

Brigands and beasts prowl, faiths collide, and lost treasures await! But this is no fantasy dungeon where the heroes go room to room killing monsters. It's an adventure setting where anything can - and will - happen. Visit the village of Stânweall, uncover mysterious factions, and witness the collision of old and new, Christian and pagan. All of this awaits the hand of willing heroes...

Roman Silver, Saxon Greed can be inserted into an existing chronicle or form the basis for an entirely new one. Just add the history books of your choice and bring the past alive!

boardgame.name: Lair of the Toad
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In your hands is a newly revised zero level adventure for use with OSRIC, 1E compatible retro clones, and all editions of the world’s greatest roleplaying game! This adventure focuses on gaming with neophyte zero-level player characters, and new parties of such would-be adventurers. This adventure takes place beneath the streets of the coastal village of Dùn Mara which is in the nation state of Dùn Bhriste, in the author's campaign world of Terrans.

SYNOPSIS: In this adventure, your players will portray a group of young friends who have grown up together in and around Dun Mara. On the fateful night of this adventure, they have met at their favourite local pub, The Golden Harp, to drink, laugh, share their dreams of adventure and maybe, if they are very lucky, to see one of the travellers from distant lands who sometimes frequent the pub. Before the night is through, they will indeed meet such a traveler, in the person of Alura Morrowgan, a fledgling magister who will seek their assistance in recovering her ancestral signet ring, which was stolen by an albino rat which then fled down a nearby sewer grate.

In the sewers below their hometown your players will face dangers they never knew existed and, if they survive the ordeal, they will earn the right to call themselves adventurers!

The adventure contains a completely detailed and keyed dungeon map, done in the Old School blue and white style, as well as new monsters to challenge your players and new magical items to thrill them. Players may use the four (4) pre-generated characters provided in this supplement or create their own with the Zero Level Player’s Guide from Starry Knight Press.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: The Old School
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mid-Level Fantast Adventure for Player Characters Levels 4-6
Compatible with OSRIC and Most Fantasy RPG systems

WHILE WANDERING IN THE WILDERNESS YOU COME ACROSS AN ANCIENT RUIN.
YOUR INVESTIGATIONS REVEALS THIS TO BE THE SITE OF A GREAT ACADEMY.
A HIDDEN STAIRWELL BECKONS YOU TO DELVE BELOW, iF YOU DARE?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am very pleased to announce release of “THE OLD SCHOOL”, the first in my all new series of Old School adventures! This module is intended for 4 to 6 seasoned adventurers of levels 4 to 6.

Synopsis: This adventure takes place off the beaten track and on the outskirts of civilization. It may be dropped into your campaign whenever your players are on a journey between destinations, as they will be exploring a locale they stumble upon by mere happenstance. Your players will be travelling when they are beset by inclement weather and, while seeking shelter, they will come across the ruins of a seemingly abandoned keep. They soon discover the keep is not actually abandoned, but has been occupied by a travelling hunting party of humanoids who were also caught out in the storm. With no other shelter in sight and the dangerous storm intensifying, your players will have to best these creatures to lay claim to this shelter

However, once they have eliminated the humanoid threat, they will learn they have discovered the ruins of an ancient training academy, which holds further secrets worth exploring. Happening upon a secret stairwell which descends into the catacombs below, your players will become trapped there and be required to run the same gauntlet the ancient academy’s student had to traverse in order to graduate.

Can your players pass this test?

In this module your players will face off against a hunting band of bugbears and then delve below the ancient, ruined Academy to unlock the secrets and treasures contained in its catacombs! It is a rollicking good hack and slash delve with a dash of nostalgia and tongue in cheek humour thrown in to boot!

This adventure is written to be compatible with OSRIC (& other OSR games), and useable with most fantasy ruleset. It features several NEW wondrous magical items and monsters to challenge and reward your players!
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: The Icy Hollow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mid-Level Fantast Adventure for Player Characters Levels 4-6
Compatible with OSRIC and Most Fantasy RPG systems

CHAOTIC FORCES HAVE OCCUPIED AN ANCIENT KEEP IN THE MOUNTAINS ABOVE TRONDVALE.
ITS NEW MASTER IS THE HEIR TO ITS COMPLICATED LEGACY OF PAIN AND SUFFERING.
CAN YOU STOP HER BEFORE SHE EXACTS HER REVENGE AND RAZES TRONDVALE?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am very happy to announce release of the second adventure in my Old School Series, “THE ICY HOLLOW”! This module is intended for 4 to 6 seasoned adventurers of levels 4 to 6. In this module your players must rescue a dwarven patrol lost on Mid-Winter's Eve. They will battle a Chaotic mage, deep dwarves, yetis and wintry extra-planar beings inside an abandoned dwarven keep!

Synopsis: This adventure takes place along the furthest northern border of the nation of The Dales, ancestral home of the dwarves, halflings, and gnomes in the world of Terrans. Your players will be taking a break in a warm, cozy inn, having chosen to celebrate the Yule holiday in the small dwarven village of Trondvale, while waiting out a winter storm.

Adventure finds them when the village sheriff asks the players for their assistance in finding a group of lost dwarven warders. The warders were sent to investigate rumours of trouble at an abandoned keep in the snowy peaks above the village, and they have not returned. With their supplies likely close to exhaustion and a winter storm kicking up, the sheriff confides that if they are not found soon they are not likely to survive.

Can your players pull off a Yuletide miracle and find the lost warders?

This adventure is written to be compatible with OSRIC (& other OSR games), and useable with most fantasy ruleset. It features several NEW wondrous magical items and monsters to challenge and reward your players!
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: The Sharif's Observatory
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A One-Page Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 2 to 4
Compatible with OSRIC and Most Fantasy RPG systems

On the Winter Solstice you journey to an old observatory in the desert.
You come seeking knowledge and treasure in its ancient, forgotten halls.
What dangers will you discover in the Last Sharif’s final resting place?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am pleased to announce release of the third adventure in my Old School Series, and my very first One-Page Dungeon, “THE SHARIF'S OBSERVATORY"! This adventure is intended for 4 to 6 adventurers of levels 2 to 4. In this scenario, which the Game Master may flesh out on their own initiative or simply run "as is", your players will be entering an abandoned stellar observatory in the mountains along the southern border of a vast desert, eager to learn its secrets.

Synopsis: After being destroyed by a devastating arcane disaster long ago, the observatory of the Last Sharif remained deserted. Recently, however, a gang of troglodytes rediscovered it, and have made it their lair. Local legends claim the observatory is rich with ancient knowledge and treasure for the taking! You have journeyed there, on the Winter Solstice, hoping to find the observatory’s fabled seeing lens.

Can your players discover the observatory's secrets and survive to tell the tale?

This one-page generic scenario is written to be compatible with most fantasy role-playing games (FRPG). It should be useable with any FRPG ruleset.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Beneath Skull Keep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A One-Page Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 6 to 8
Compatible with OSRIC and Most Fantasy RPG systems

Beneath the ruined fortress of Skull Keep lies an ancient secret.
Its forgotten halls hold the secret entrance to a vampire's lair.
Marauders disturbed the beast, and now it thirsts for mortal blood!

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am pleased to announce release of the fourth adventure in my Old School Series, and my second One-Page Dungeon, “BENEATH SKULL KEEP"! This adventure is intended for 4 to 6 seasoned adventurers of levels 6 to 8. In this scenario, which the Game Master may flesh out on their own initiative or simply run "as is", your players will be entering the dungeon level of a ruined keep, on the request of the local sheriff, to reconnoiter the activity of a group of vicious marauders who have recently taken up residence there, eager to plunder its riches.

Synopsis: The ruins of Skull Keep have been abandoned for centuries. Local legends claim dire evil and great magic can be found there. Recently, marauders went looking for these lost treasures; none were ever seen again. The local Sheriff asks you to confirm the fate of these marauders.

Do you dare to delve below Skull Keep?

This one-page generic scenario is written to be compatible with most fantasy role-playing games (FRPG). It should be useable with any FRPG ruleset.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: The Tainted Ossuary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A One-Page Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 2 to 4
Compatible with OSRIC and Most Fantasy RPG systems

The Scalar townsfolk have buried their dead in the ossuary just outside their village for centuries.
However, the arrival of a “mysterious stranger” has stirred up those interred in these catacombs.
The local Sheriff has asked for your help cleansing the place. Will you brave the tainted ossuary?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am pleased to announce release of the fifth adventure in my Old School Series, and my third One-Page Dungeon, “THE TAINTED OSSUARY"! This adventure is intended for 4 to 6 new adventurers of levels 2 to 4. In this scenario, which the Game Master may flesh out on their own initiative or simply run "as is", your players will be entering these ancient catacombs, on the request of the local Sheriff, to get the bottom of disturbances among the dead and buried there.

Synopsis: The “mysterious stranger” the villagers speak of was a treasure hunter named Slif Yorgen. He came here following rumours about a powerful wizard, known as the Magister. Legends claim she had the power to raise the dead and control frost magics; and that she was buried with her prized magics in this ossuary, near her birthplace. Slif found and dug up her tomb, but he struck an underground aquifer in the process, flooding the catacombs. Sadly, he learned the legends were only partially true: the Magister was interred here with her magic…but she was not quite dead!

This one-page generic scenario is written to be compatible with most fantasy role-playing games (FRPG). It should be useable with any FRPG ruleset.

boardgame.name: Ignis Pass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A High Level Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 10 to 12
Compatible with OSRIC and Most Fantasy RPG systems

AFTER BEING DESTROYED BY AN ARCANE DISASTER EONS AGO, THIS GRAND ARCHIVE REMAINED DESERTED.
RECENTLY A CLAN OF FIRE GIANTS HAS MADE ITS LAIRS HERE AND HAS BEGUN RAIDING IN THE NEARBY AREA.
YOU ARE TASKED TO END THEIR OCCUPATION AND RECOVER THE LEGENDARY BLADE STORMTIDE, IF YOU DARE.

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am happy to announce the release of the sixth adventure in my Old School Series, “IGNIS PASS"! This adventure is intended for 4 to 6 veteran adventurers of levels 10 to 12. In this scenario, your players will be entering the lair of a tribe of aggressive and deadly fire giants, tasked with eliminating the threat they pose and, hopefully, unearth the rare artifact of power Stormtide, rumoured to buried there.

Synopsis: Ignis Pass leads over a mostly dormant volcano on The Imperium’s western border, near Arae village. In a stone complex at the pass’ apex lies the fabled Twilight Archive of Loukan, where the epic blade Stormtide was kept in days past. Fire giants have taken refuge there now, waylaying travellers and threatening the border. You are tasked to stop them. Good luck!

This three level dungeon delve is written to be generic and compatible with most fantasy role-playing games (FRPG). It should be useable with any FRPG ruleset.

boardgame.name: Hot Lead
boardgame.description:
Lead the undercover investigation against five criminal groups to gather enough evidence to convict them. However, if you investigate too aggressively, the criminals will smell a rat and go dark!

In each round of Hot Lead, criminal cards are displayed in a column equal to the number of players. Players then make their bid by simultaneously revealing an investigator card from their hand. The highest investigator bid takes the criminal card closest to the deck, the second highest takes the second closest, and so on. These cards are worth points equal to their face value (0-5).

Gather enough evidence on one criminal organization to convict them when the game concludes after ten rounds; in game terms, by having exactly three of a suit, you earn 10 bonus points. Ten bonus points are also awarded to those who acquire criminal cards of all five suits. If you investigate too aggressively and grab the fourth card of a suit, those criminals will sense a rat and you'll scare them underground, thereby losing all of those cards. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Glorious First of June: a scenario for Far Distant Ships
boardgame.description:
The Glorious First of June - Le Bataille du 13 Prairial An 2 is a scenario pack covering the battle known to the British as the Glorious First of June, and to the French as La Bataille du 13 prairial an 2, 1st June 1794.

boardgame.name: Run, Cowboy, Run!
boardgame.description:
Run, Cowboy, Run! is a fast-paced race through the desert in which each player controls a running cowboy. The first cowboy over the finish line is the winner!

Players take turns collecting and discarding cards, in order to score points by making pairs, taking tricks and collecting gold suited cards, moving their cowboy past the others and closer to the finish line.

But watch out! Rattlesnakes! Dynamite! Bandits! And more! Players can use their collected hazard cards to stop other players in their tracks: moving their own cowboys forward and moving opponents' cowboys backwards on the track.

Run, Cowboy, Run! is strategic, trick-taking card game for 2 to 6 players, ages 10+. The game comes with 56 playing cards, 6 running cowboys, the track, and detailed instructions.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Selva: La fuerza de la Naturaleza
boardgame.description: Selva is a Chilean Trading Card Game in which players pitch the forces of nature against each other. Turns are split into two phases, a day phase and a night phase, in which different kinds of animals can attack, depending on their natural habits. You can try to block attacks against you, and you will try to increase the number of resource cards on the table to be able to add more cards to your layout. The goal is to reduce your opponent(s) Alpha animal to 0 life points.

boardgame.name: Hegemon: A Wargaming Campaign in Ancient Greece
boardgame.description:
Hegemon: A Wargaming Campaign in Ancient Greece is set circa 340BCE and pits Macedon against Persia with Greece as the battlefield.
It is specifically designed for DBA 3.0 but is likely to be easily adapted to other sets of rules which cater for battles of around ten to 20 units.

The campaign features a point to point map of Greece. Each turn represents a year and consists of a winter administration phase and two campaign seasons.
Campaigns are likely to last three to five years (although a spectacular failure could see a campaign concluded in a single year) and likely to feature an average of three battles per year.

During winter players spend their budget to bribe/persuade Greek city states in a variety of ways to make them amenable to a player's plans and to buy new elements to reinforce armies in the following year.
During each of the two campaign seasons players move their army or armies on the map and invade hostile Greek states, the armies of which are played by the opposing player.

The winner of the campaign will be the player who allies the greatest number of Greek states, or at least renders them neutral, by the time either Macedon or Persia cannot field an army sufficiently strong to continue.

Although written with this specific hypothetical campaign as its basis, the campaign mechanisms are portable to other eras and armies, with the requirement only that the player create an appropriate point to point map of the area of operations. The article includes half a dozen ways in which to vary the original campaign and brief notes suggesting other historical conflicts of the classical period which might be simulated.

The article is fourteen pages long and incorporates a campaign map and a budget tracking graphic.

Finally it also presents a very simple methodology for resolving battles in a DBA style using any flat surface and 30 or so dice of different colours. This will allow the player to experiment with the campaign framework without committing himself to six to twelve DBA battles.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC

boardgame.name: Skojarzenia
boardgame.description:
Each player or team starts at a corner of the board and movies along a track to the center. Players, in turns, draw cards containing phrases belonging to various categories and then they either pantomime or make drawings to indicate the phrase that matches the color of the spot they are on. A timer keeps every turn short.

Each player or team mark their score on the board. The first team to get to the centre spot on the board win the game.

The game contains 2100 phrases on 300 cards.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Butter
boardgame.description:
Butter is a quick and engaging card game with simple rules but wide-ranging strategy. Once you have a few singles games under your belt, try team play! The rules change slightly, but the strategy explodes with so many more possibilities.

The game centers around adding number cards to your stack so they sum to 18, which is called buttering your stack. You earn one point for every card you butter. Use Slice, Churn, Spoil, and Butter cards to steal, swap, and bust your and other player's stacks.

To win, score the most points in three rounds!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Outbound
boardgame.description:
This overhead shoot-em 'up is sort of an arcade version of MechWarrior. You'll take your beefed-up Armored Mobile Vehicle (AMV) to eight different planets, each with unique environments and missions. As soon as you land, you'll engage swarms of enemy bots and fulfill your objectives. In some scenarios you'll have to destroy bases, substations and rescue marooned allies. The action climaxes on the planet Gateway, where you blow up the enemy's main battle station and hastily return to your dropship.

https://www.old-games.com/download/2611/outbound

boardgame.name: L'histoire en boîte le jeu
boardgame.description:
Each player chooses an epoch to build his/her empire in, antiquity, the middle ages, the modern, or the contemporary one. Each epoch consist of 50 cards (40 questions, 5 bonus and 5 penalty cards).

At the beginning of the game each epoch deck is shuffled and placed in front of the player to the right, that player will be asking the questions.

The youngest player starts the game. On his turn he must answer questions related to his epoch. The question cards contains two questions, from which only one will be asked. Each time you get an answer right you gain the card and your turn continues. When an incorrect answer is given, the turn is ended and play moves on to the next player on the left.

On the back of each question card is a drawing that is part of the epoch fresco that the player is trying to complete. With each right answer, the question card is placed in front of the player with the drawing side up, helping to complete the fresco.

Penalty and Bonus cards contains only one question. A wrong answer for a penalty card makes you lose an already won card. A right answer for a bonus card lets you keep the bonus card to protect you against a penalty card.

The first payer to correctly answers 40 questions and complete his/her fresco wins.

—user summary


Défiez vos proches et devenez le plus grand bâtisseur de tous les temps !

Revivez les grands moments qui ont marqué l'Histoire et tentez de construire votre propre civilisation.

Plus qu'un quiz historique, c'est une aventure où chaque bonne réponse permet d'acquérir un élément historique caractéristique d'une époque (villa, château fort, théâtre, musée...) et de bâtir un empire.

Un jeu de connaissance et de construction

200 cartes et 380 questions

boardgame.name: Battle for the Carolinas Dice
boardgame.description:
The war for independence has moved south towards the Carolinas. Patriots are eager to break from the mother country. England is threatening to extinguish any rebellion that dares to foment disobedience to the crown. Battles and skirmishes dot the countryside of the Carolinas. Choose your side and defend your cause!

Battle for the Carolinas Dice is a dice game where the roll of the dice determines your position on the battlefield. Move your soldiers, bring in more reinforcements and treat the wounded to get them back on the battlefield. When in range, fire at your opponent to inflict damage or casualties.

If your opponent's dice count dwindles down to three active before you do, you win!

The fate of the Carolinas begins with the roll of the dice...

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Tipping Guam
boardgame.description:
The island of Guam is in a perilous situation. Thanks to the courage of one brave elected official who was willing to speak up, we now know that the island of Guam is actually a lily pad precariously floating in the Pacific Ocean. If the balance of the island is not altered significantly, Guam will tip and capsize. Both military bases panic and begin to ship all of their resources to the other side of the island, so their side will not be under water if the island capsizes.

Tipping Guam is a two player game in which each player will try to move their personnel and equipment to the opposite side of the island, strategically placing them on their opponent’s tipping points. If all the tipping points of your opponent’s side of the island have pieces on them, you win the game!

An entry into the 2021 Two Player Game Design contest.

boardgame.name: Battle for Diratia
boardgame.description:
Are you a fan of realistic fantasy? A connoisseur of Sci-Fi, space travel, and wargaming? Or even a GM looking for an exciting RPG system with constant updates?
Then Battle for Diratia (Aka BFD) is for you!

This system is made by two veteran GMs who, tired of switching system mid-campaign, decided to make a more versatile system. Characters that feel human, a unique universe and a system that is ever evolving and contemporary. BFD as a combat system can adjust to every group, every setting, style of play, and player.

You will never have to learn another ruleset. BFD works for 3v3 skirmish, for immersive roleplaying, and for 1000v1000 total warfare.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Կինոգետ (Film Critic)
boardgame.description:
Each round consists of 4 questions.
If you answer the question incorrectly, you stop
Players who answer all 4 questions correctly will participate in the Random round which will decide the winner of that round.

The game contains:

328 playing cards about 70 most famous Armenian movies,
a book of movie lists (2 copies),
as well as the rules of the game.


The interactivity of the game is provided by the QR codes included in the playing cards, which, after being scanned, will show information (video, sound bites etc...) about the card.

The cards contains the following

Guess the movie according to the mentioned phrase (150),
continue the popular secret speech (60);
According to the presented picture, guess the film (30);
According to the presented music, guess the film (30);
prompt your teammates (30) of the movie according to the keyword;
List the films with the participation of the actor (28).

boardgame.name: Paw Paw Paw
boardgame.description:
Paw Paw Paw is a 2D Sidescroller Beat ‘Em Up game for PC and Consoles. You play as part of the resistance in their effort to bring down the King. Hack and slash your way to victory, and beat all your enemies into pulps!

Play single player or local co-op up to 4 players
Level up your character
Unlock new combo
Loot and equip new weapons
Hire companion to help you in battle
Ride your mount into battle

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Այլ կերպ (Another way)
boardgame.description:
Այլ կերպ ("Another way") is a team-based game where players have to guess words.

Gameplay:
One player draws a card, explains to his teammates the 7 words written on the card one at a time, without using identical words nor the translation of that word into other languages. Each guessed word is 1 point.
1 minute is allowed.

The team with the most points win.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Բժշկությունն ԱՅԼ ԿԵՐՊ ( Another way Medical)

boardgame.name: The F. A. Cup Game
boardgame.description:
In the game, you get 144 cards, split into 2 decks of Chances (really good scoring chances), and Half-Chances (long shot scoring chances). Teams are rated simply for goals scored and goals allowed, home and away. Each team is rated further for who scores the team's goals when a goal is scored.

Depending on the goals scored rating of the team and the goals allowed rating of the opponent, each team will get a certain number of possible chances per game. The trick is that not all those chances will come up in a game and, despite having more possible total chances in a match than the opposition, a streak of bad luck could lead to the big upset. Players roll two six sided dice, one to see if anything happens in that period of time (1 out of six times you get a Chance, 1 out of six you get a Half Chance, 4 out of six you get nothing ). You roll each half of the match until you run out of possible chances.

Example: one team has 7 chances, the other team has 3. There will be a total of 10 dice rolls to make up a single half of play. If you roll a 5 or 6, flip a FAC and a further roll of the dice will happen to determine the outcome.

The Chance and Half-Chance cards have descriptive play calls on them so you really get the feel of watching the highlights reel of a match. You will have high scoring shootouts and defensive stalemates.

Included are:

124 Team Indicator cards which are used to identify and rate the *128 competing teams;
16 dice of various colors which are used to determine the shots missed and the goals scored during the game. A team rating determines the number of dice rolled - a five might be a goal while a 6 is always a goal;
a Match Die Chart to cross-reference against the ratings for each team;
a Goal Misses Chart, which adds imagery;
a Goal Description Chart, which also adds to the imagery;
a Rule Book; and a description of how to convert the F. A. Cup system to various sized leagues.


The game also requires a deck of regular playing cards which you can order with the game or supply yourself.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Card Night: Classic Games, Classic Decks, and The History Behind Them
boardgame.description:
Learn when to hold 'em and when to fold 'em with Card Night, a collection of 52 classic card games, including rules and strategies.

Featuring step-by-step, illustrated instructions, and two indexes that organize each game by difficulty and number of players needed, Card Night includes directions for playing all the most popular card games, including Hearts and Bridge, Rummy and Go Fish.

In addition to providing the rules of standard game play, Card Night also details the fascinating stories and peculiarities behind some of the world's most famous card decks, some of which were used as currency, tools for propaganda, and even as a means for sending coded messages.

Offering one game for each week of the year, Card Night is the go-to companion for weekly game nights, long car rides, and rainy days spent at home. Wow your friends and family with your game playing prowess and keep them entertained with fascinating details from playing card history.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Sword and Fire: Manila
boardgame.description:
Manila, on the Philippine island of Luzon, was known throughout the world as "The Pearl of the Orient" for its lush gardens, modern buildings, and vibrant nightlife. It was also a strategically critical naval base, featuring the largest deep-water port in the Pacific. With the fall of the Philippines in 1942, the Japanese turned Manila into an enormous supply depot serving as a hub from which supplies could be shipped to bases across the Pacific, all the while ruling the Philippines with an iron fist. After more than two years of brutal Japanese occupation, General Douglas MacArthur "returned" to the Philippines in October 1944 at Leyte Gulf. In January 1945, the Americans invaded Luzon. They reached the outskirts of Manila in the first week of February and prepared to assault the city. The Japanese commander of Manila, Admiral Sanji Iwabuchi, had no grand plan for victory; just a fight to the death, taking as many American lives as possible.

Sword and Fire: Manila is a Historical Advanced Squad Leader (HASL) module covering the month-long American effort to wrest control of "The Pearl" from the Japanese. Arrayed against the attackers was a mixture of veteran Japanese Marine and Army units and inexperienced Naval units composed of sailors, aircraft crewmen, and conscripted laborers with little or no formal ground combat training or experience. They were well-equipped with numerous machine guns as well as anti-aircraft guns ranging from 12.7mm to 120mm. They would fight for every building, every courtyard, and every garden as the defenses fell back upon the ancient walls of Intramuros. Built by the Spaniards in 1571 as a fortress town, this walled city would be Iwabuchi’s “Alamo”.

Sword and Fire: Manila features rules for the city's unique terrain types such as Multi-Material, Adobe, and Steel-Walled Buildings; Stone Monuments; Bomb Craters; the many detailed elements of Intramuros; and a host of others. Twenty-five scenarios and five Campaign Games (CG) – ranging in size from 6-15 CG Dates – are played out on the six map sheets depicting the city.

—description from the publihser

boardgame.name: Havoc Wuzhuang Temple
boardgame.description:
This picture book and game tells the story of Havoc Wuzhuang Temple. The master and disciples came to Wuzhuang Temple. The disciples stole and ate the ginseng fruit and were detained by Zhenyuan Immortal. Monkey King had to seek help from all over the world, and finally invited Guanyin Bodhisattava to save the ginseng fruit tree.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: Understand the use of multiplication table; Recognize area; Understand the division; Observe the crystallization phenomenon. It also includes the logical ability training activity and logical reasoning training activity.

To win 6 levels of the game:

Steal Ginseng Fruit: Infer the numbers in the grid and get 8 different numbers, mark the numbers with color to show the Ginseng Fruit image
Eat the Manfruit: Complete the puzzle, take out the manfruit cubes one by one, and restore the puzzle to a rectangle for 3 times
Cover up and trick Taoist: Based on the information on the card, infer who told the truth and who lied, then infer who ate the ginseng fruit and who hide the manfruit
Fight with Immortal Zhenyuan in the Mountain：Flip the pieces and beat your opponent, the player with more pieces on the board wins
Get the Magic Water to Save the Immortal Tree: Complete the tree puzzle, mix the powder and water, pour the solution onto the tree and observe the crystallization phenomenon
Immortals Gather and Taste the Fruit: Tuck the required number of rubber bands on the card to ensure the ginseng fruits can be evenly divided as required. The first one finishes 3 cards wins the game.


After player complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game. The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Accessible Gaming Quarterly (Issue 201 - Jun 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

When I started Accessible Games in 2010, I knew that people with disabilities were woefully underrepresented in our hobby. I received validation of that fact everywhere. From local conventions to GenCon, from RPGGeek to Twitter, I encountered story after story about the difficulties people with disabilities often face when participating in the hobby.
Accessible Gaming Quarterly is my answer to that problem. This zine, funded through Kickstarter by a community of people with disabilities and our allies, raises awareness of accessibility and disability in the RPG hobby. We’re bringing together writers, designers, and artists to showcase and represent the many talents of disabled creators and giving a voice to their stories.

This fifth issue of the zine features seven articles:

"Questions and Answers with Accessible Games" by Jacob Wood
"Do-It-Yourself Accessibility" by Justin Oldham
"Character Snapshot: Darlene Lambert" by Justin Oldham
"Accessibility, It Does Matter" by Richard Bennett
"The Terror" by Jim O'Donnell
"Character Snapshot: Sage" by T Dave Silva
"Piratical Prosthetics" by Jacob Wood


The digital edition of this zine includes Vision Layers, which allows users to toggle between different viewing options in the PDF. Choose from color or black-and-white, with or without background elements, and text-only options. The PDF is also tagged for improved readability with screen readers.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Questions and Answers with Accessible Games

boardgame.name: PANTONE: Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description: A mini-expansion consisting of three new character cards (Rick Sanchez, Princess Leila, Little Marmaid) and 14 swatch cards.

listing.notes: Shipping at your own charge

boardgame.name: The Island of Doctor Moreau: An Interactive Adventure
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book

In the latter part of the nineteenth century, Noble’s Island was known as little more than an uninhabited volcanic outcropping set like an emerald in the middle of the tempestuous South Pacific Ocean. But in truth, it is home to a strange breed of twisted and malformed creatures who are ruled over by their powerful and enigmatic master, the infamous vivisectionist Doctor Moreau, a scientist whose ambition and thirst for knowledge knows no bounds…

YOU are a passenger aboard the ill-fated ship The Lady Vain. When it sinks after colliding with a drifting derelict, you are thrown into a perilous adventure of survival, exploration, and dark discoveries. In this work of interactive fiction, YOU make the choices and decide your fate…

The Island of Doctor Moreau – An Interactive Adventure is a re-imagining of the classic nineteenth century work of scientific fiction by H.G. Wells, presented as an exciting adventure gamebook. Will you uncover the secrets and survive the perils of Doctor Moreau’s island, the only land within a thousand leagues of anywhere?

Only YOU can decide!

boardgame.name: Janosik
boardgame.description:
Few words about the game. It is an action adventure game with a retro feel and pixel graphics. To be more specific – it is metroidvania. Janosik is the main protagonist. Player has to help him to take back his companions. Game is fast, the controls are tight. You will experience precise platforming action, fights, exploration and lots of fun

So who is Janosik?

Janosik was legendary Slovak highlander robber. According to the legend, he robbed nobles and gave the loot to the poor. He is known as Slovakian’s Robin Hood.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.description:
Hunting... Trapping... in the dream dimension, people are stalked by fear. Nightmare, an ageless demon who rules this realm is collecting dream energy from humans and placing the entire world under extradimensional threats from him and his villains. Team up with wondrous heroes and the Master of the Mystic Arts, Doctor Strange in this new Legendary expansion where you’ll race to power up your deck with the legendary defender before feeding the dream-stalking enemy with unstoppable power!

Doctor Strange returns to Legendary bringing more mystic heroes to join the vast pool of amazing super-heroes!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Janosik 2
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Janosik 2 is a retro action-platformer with metroidvania elements. Get ready to jump, slash, dodge roll, dive, smash and bash your way through deadly traps, mischievous villains, troublesome bosses and more in this sequel to Janosik. You’ve never played a fairytale this cheerful and deadly.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Millennial AF
boardgame.description:
What is a mile… What is a mimosa… What is a millennial? It’s a pretty common question on Google. The millennial generation has generated more intrigue than any other. And rightly so in our opinion. That’s why we created Millennial AF: the “Who’s most likely to” card game that’ll reveal the biggest bottomless brunching, quinoa munching, Insta-influencing millennial in your group.

Here’s how it might play out…
Jess: “Who’s most likely to… text ‘I’m outside’ rather than ring the doorbell?
Josh: “Well that can’t be me. I’d never do that.”
Sam: “That’s totes something you’d do, Josh!”
Jess: “Josh IMHO.”
George: “Josh. Without a doubt.”
Josh: “WTF?!”

Josh then gets that card. And at the end each player tallies their cards; the one with the most is the most millennial of them all.

Millennial AF is the generational game based on typical millennial traits. You’ll be surprised at just how millennial we all are…

boardgame.name: Rune & Write
boardgame.description:
Rune & Write is a game with roll and write mechanic with symbol combination and rune casting that lasts between 30-40 minutes and designed for 1 to 4 players based on the universe of Runaljod: The sound of the runes.

Rune & Write is played over 8 rounds in which all players can take turns simultaneously. Each player will try to be as efficient as possible with the runes they have available and their possible combinations.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Snow White Solitaire. Charmed Kingdom
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A mix of story telling, hidden objects and solitaire card game set after the Evil Queen was defeated by Snow White as the kingdom is threatened by a terrible curse.

boardgame.name: Teen Witches Academy
boardgame.description:
In this adult visual novel you will take the role of the Main Character, a powerful Mage who has been banned by the Magic World Council after they used him to win the hard war against Obscure Magic.

He will be brought back to freedom by a mysteriuos powerful Mage Lord, called Gorath, the Lord of CORRUPTION, who can give his power back.

In return MC must accept to take the role of the headmaster in a Teen School of Magic, and bring all the teen witches to CORRUPTION!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Gutenberg
구텐베르크: 활자의 혁명
boardgame.description:
Gutenberg is a board game for 1-4 people in which players will play as the pioneers of printing in the 15th century. By carrying out orders, they will build their wealth and fame. By improving their printing workshops and gaining the support of patrons, they will develop their production capacity. The game will be won by a printer who boasts the greatest recognition and wealth.

By bidding for specific actions, players will develop their workshop, acquire new fonts, inks and decorations. The unique system of rotating gears allows you to combine bonuses and earn a large number of points.

The game is won by the player with the most points after six rounds.
