boardgame.name: Steam Highwayman 3: The Reeking Metropolis
Steam Highwayman III: The Reeking Metropolis
Steam Highwayman: The Reeking Metropolis
boardgame.description:
The city teems with desperate life. Smog and mug clog the streets and waterways while the outskirts are haunted by robbers. Rumours are muttered in every inn and tavern: "The Compact are preparing for revolution... The Guilds are at each other's throats... Jewel thieves eye the Tower of London..."

In The Reeking Metropolis you can duel with the gentry and shake hands with sweeps. Will you form your own street gang or run an industrial workshop? Will you get your hands on gems or lose them to a guild punishment? Will you resort to the lowliest of employments in the dust yards or sewers, or will you mount to the other filthy extreme and represent the people as a Member of Parliament?

Steam Highwayman is an open-world adventure gamebook series in which you, the reader, must choose your path through an alternative Steampunk history. With a pair of dice and a pencil you can track your adventure through an England that never was, discovering secrets, solving quests, rescuing those in need and punishing those who deserve vengeance. The midnight road calls!

boardgame.name: Midgard Worldbook (5E)
Midgard Worldbook for 5th Edition
Mythgart Weltenbuch
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure In a Dark World of Deep Magic for 5th Edition!

It is an age of war. Civilization slowly gives way to encroaching wilderness, and once-mighty empires now lie beneath the waves. Only magic and the warmth of hope keeps lights aglow when dread things prowl, and priestly wardings are bent by demonic rage.

The omens are dire. The roads to the shadow realm are open again, and the fey have returned to claim their ancient tribute. In the north the giants prepare for Ragnarok, while the goblins in the west grow restless. In the Crossroads, the shadow of the vampire princes falls across the land. The World Serpent is stirring—and not even all-knowing Baba Yaga can say what will happen next.

Now more than ever, Midgard needs 5E heroes to stand against the dark, driving it back with spell, steel, and cunning!

The 460-page Midgard Worldbook for 5th Edition includes:

Detailed description of Midgard's empires, cities, and kingdoms, with associated heraldry, rulers, and adventure hooks for each state, large or small
Characters from Baba Yaga to the lords of the Dragon Empire, from the honest folk of Zobeck to various elven holdouts of Dornig and the vampire lords of Morgau
Full lore on the pantheons of the Northlands, Crossroads, Elves, and others, including domain lists, rituals, divine demands, and the various masks and sacred texts—plus rituals and ambitions of the Dark Gods, for the GM's eyes alone!
Setting-specific lore of the planes, history, calendars, and conflicts of the world to enrich your stories and campaigns
Forbidden lore of blood magic, void magic, and various dooms and items not meant for players' eyes!
A complete Index of the book's people, places, and major terms
Encounter tables for each region of the setting and the planes!
And much more!
Start your next campaign off right—put your 5th Edition D&D players on a dark road!

boardgame.name: Escape From Site 19: Candle
boardgame.description: A candle in the shape of the SCP Foundation logo. One piece is included in every copy, extra candles can be purchased in the e-shop.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Extreme Board Games, s. r. o.

boardgame.name: Kobold Guide to Monsters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let the Monster Masters Guide You

Classic monsters can get stale, and Game Masters often need to generate their own monstrosities to properly challenge players. But concepting, creating, and using monsters is no easy feat for any Game Master—and that’s where this book comes in. In these pages, 15 of the brightest stars in the gaming industry share their wisdom for conceptualizing, developing, and maximizing the “Wow!” factor of monsters.

Step by step, the writers show how to think up a new idea—or modify an existing one—then refine and test the design and get the absolute most out of the creature. Ever wanted to build a monster from mythology or pop culture? Use psychology theory to power your monsters’ motivations? Get advice for when your players try to befriend a beast? This book has you covered! Through simple but effective techniques, these experts demonstrate how to:

put an adversary’s environment and resources to best use
employ common-sense motivations to guide a creature’s behavior and choices
develop realistic alternatives to just fighting—and dying
grab every player’s attention with powerful, sensory-filled descriptions
make monsters much more than a piece of art coupled with a block of statistics!


Presented in thoughtful progression, this book contains essays by RPG veterans Monte Cook, Wolfgang Baur, Mike Mason, Crystal Frasier, Mike Shea, Shanna Germain, Steve Winter, and many more--and is edited by Wizards of the Coast staff designer Amanda Hamon. They have created your favorite monsters from the most prominent roleplaying game publishers around. Now let them turn you into a Monster Master, too!

boardgame.name: Doctor Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ROLL AND DIE!

A huge fan of tabletop roleplaying games and a master at engineering deathtrap-filled mazes, Doctor Dungeon is a favorite in the villain community. All manner of baddies vie to place their heroic nemeses in his mazes and watch their demise with glee!

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone recognizes, even when meeting them for the first time.

boardgame.name: Shadow Affairs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Shadow Affairs, the brutality of the alien’s invading forces is only matched by the cynicism of the Human Sphere’s powers and hubris, placing the international base of Libra 5 in dire danger. Composed of units from the best and worst humanity can provide, the players will have to join this eclectic base and try to work it into a competent force before their enemy decides to interfere.

The largest, most detailed campaign in the Human Sphere so far written. Designed to introduce new players into the universe of the Human Sphere while challenging the veteran player, this Campaign has something for all.

Detailed maps, carefully explained scenarios, and dozens of side-quests to ensure your tour in Paradiso is as twisted as the Wilderness of Mirrors!
Carefully balanced encounters and challenges to ensure your gameplay is exciting and hard enough to keep everyone invested.
NPC’s, equipment, antagonists... All the resources needed for you to run the campaign without recurring to other Sourcebooks.


Team Mercury! A whole team of agents ready to help, substitute, sabotage, or even battle the Player Characters, plus rules on how to convert your team of PC’s into playable N3 units!

boardgame.name: Horror in the Huuls
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

At the edge of the dour Huul Marshes lies the sleepy village of Dun Mounds. Long have the humble folk that call the tiny habitation their home lived in peace there, but an ancient evil stirs within the wetlands, eager to drown Dun Mounds beneath the dark waters of the fen. Can your heroes turn back their assault and defeat the sinister forces that guide them before the village is brought to ruin?

This challenging scenario introduces Jay L. Scott's legendary Order of Kelu Campaign©. It includes new special character classes, exciting combat and spellcasting proficiencies, magic items, spells, and much more -- content that has evolved over the 40 years of that Campaign's existence. Its first chapter has been specially-designed to work with games using miniatures and includes instructions that will help Game Masters and players make the most of its content. With pre-generated characters, referee's maps, notes, encounter descriptions and an extensive background story between its covers, although JS1 is a complete adventure in and of itself, it has been developed in such a way that it can easily be used in the context of a pre-existing campaign.

An [adventure] for PCs level 3-6.

Softcover Dungeon Module including:


74 Pages Perfect Bound
34 Encounters
13 Photographic Map Aids to help facilitate Miniatures Play
1 Dungeon Map
4 New Special Character Classes
6 Variant Magic Items
15 Spells
Original Cover Art by Chet Minton
8 Pre-Generated Characters with fully realised backgrounds
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Bud Tucker in Double Trouble
boardgame.description:
Zany Plot!

Bud's adventure takes him to the bustling metropolis of Barryville, where he becomes entagnled in a plot involving an over-friendly Welshman, a bungee jumping elephant and two of the ugliest hula girls in history!

WHen an eccentric professor is kidnapped and his latest invention stolen, it's up to Bud Tucker, pizza delivery boy and owner of the biggest quiff this side of Memphis to save the day!

boardgame.name: The Druid Master
boardgame.description:
Welcome to The Druid Master, a tabletop game that will teach you the healing power of medicinal herbs.
An educational fast paced cards game for 1-4 players.

"You are in the middle of the forest, wrapped in the reassuring embrace of nature, and as a Druid you hold and master the ancient art of healing the various ailments, which affect the human body, with the herbs, plants and trees that surround you.

And so different people will come looking for you who need your help but, beware, you are not alone!

There are also other experienced Druids who compete with you to cure these patients.

You will have to prove that you can treat them better than your rival Druids, so that you will be proclaimed the one and only Druid Master!"

The game consists of 8 rounds where players will have to treat patients with the plants at their disposal.

The plants are represented by cards, which describe the benefits of the plant in percentages.

7 plant cards are drawn at the beginning of the game and 2 at the beginning of each turn.

You can use from 1 to 3 plant cards, in combination, to try to cure the patient as much as possible.

(You can study best combination hidden by the proper player screen)

Each turn an event card is drawn that affects all players (famine, harvest day...).

There are also effect cards: one for each player, to be played in the best moment of the game, to take an advantage on the other players or to hinder them.

boardgame.name: Lace Warfare: Tactical Level Combat in the Age of Reason
boardgame.description:
Lace Warfare: Tactical Level Combat in the Age of Reason primarily covers the Austrian Succession, Seven Years War, French and Indian War, and American War of Independence, but can also be employed for the War of the Grand Alliance, War of the Spanish Succession, and the Great Northern War.

Lace Warfare uses miniature model soldiers on a table laid out with model terrain, along with dice, rulers, and various markers.
There is no bookkeeping involved in these rules. All changes in status can be represented on the table by markers, stand positions etc...
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession

boardgame.name: Brány Skeldalu
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Czech dungeon crawler set in the fantasy island country of Rovenland where the powerful wizard Freghar senses evil growing in the south summons three adventures using the Krow-kane ritual and sends them out to atop five renegade mages trying to open the gates to the forbidden Zohar dimension.

The name of the game means "Gates of Skeldal"
boardgame.videogameversion: European/Czech DOS CD-ROM Game 4 You re-release

boardgame.name: 7 Mages
Seven Mages
boardgame.description:
7 Mages (Czech: Brány Skeldalu: 7 Mágů, literally Gates of Skeldal: 7 Mages) is a 2016 video game developed by Napoleon Games. It is the third installment in Gates of Skeldal series. 7 Mages a tactical, turn-based game with that focuses on musical magic. Each character has a tune they can play to directly affect anyone within earshot.

The story is an adaptation of Akira Kurosawa's benchmark film, Seven Samurai.

Source: Wikipedia, "7 Mages", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: HeroTec: Tokens
boardgame.description:
16 laser-cut tokens for tracking equipment levels within the game.

Compatible with the Job Insecurity expansion which increase player count up to 4 people (4 tokens per player).

boardgame.name: King's Orders
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





You are a medieval ruler issuing orders to your armies. The catch - your messengers might not always make it.User Summary

boardgame.name: Tic Tac Tics
boardgame.description: Tic-tac-toe on 5x5 grid. Three in a row is called a run. Four in a row gets an extra run and five in a row gets extra three runs. When the grid is filled, the difference between the winner and the loser is called the net run. Play then continues to a new sheet. First player to score 11 net runs wins.

boardgame.name: Fuckstory: Friday
Fuckstory: Pátek
boardgame.description:
User summary

You wake up a Friday morning, and have to go to school and after spending some time there invite your girl to a date and get away from school.

The game is made by David Havlíčk.

boardgame.name: The Game of Fuzzy Logic
boardgame.description:
The Game of Fuzzy Logic. The game where the best clues are the ones that aren't too good. Are you clever enough to give clarity to your teammates while simultaneously confusing your rivals?

In Fuzzy Logic, two teams take on pairs of mystery words, going head-to-head to see which team can correctly guess its word first. Here’s the twist: Each pair of words is in some way related, so really good clues are ones that help your team while at the same time hindering your opponents!

The first team to win 9 points wins the game.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Mechanism: Give a Clue / Get a Clue

boardgame.name: Brain Freeze
boardgame.description:
Get to know friends and family better. When the fastest answer wins, you never know what they’ll let slip.

Get your friends and family shouting out the hilarious answers that are top of mind. Simple gameplay will have you playing in seconds.

The player with the most points at the end of the game, wins.

boardgame.name: Fuckstory 2: Škola je kráva
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Czech text adventure game by David Havlíčk, where you wake up in an cold autumn day and hurry to the institute where you will try to have a chance to talk with Kristýna.

boardgame.name: Fuckstory 3: Gimpl
boardgame.description:
Fuckstory 3: Gimpl (2004) “The third sequel to the story of a peculiar teenager - Cend. After many years spent in elementary school, he was finally lucky, he was accepted to high school. And not just any school. He attends a grammar school. But he finds out that high school is unfortunately only an educational institution and that he will have to learn here as well. In addition, the school does not have enough places, so it goes on night shifts. Cenda also has to spend nights in an old school building, so it's no wonder he's regaining opposition to school. And so, one day (or rather night), he runs away from school and goes home. There will be no shortage of love this time either. There is a traditional pilgrimage in the city and there, Čenda meets again a beautiful girl whom he met at a driving school. And because the pilgrimage can be quite a romantic affair, it creates another fuck-story. Fuckstory 3: Gimpl is much longer than previous parts. In addition, it is spread over two consecutive days. You will also visit many more places and meet more people than in Fuckstory: Friday and Fuckstory 2: School is a cow. Stylistics is a bit different ... It's no longer very similar to C. D. Payne, with whom the writing style in FS1 and FS2 was compared. Nevertheless, the game is conceived as a cheerful humorous thing for young people who annoy the conventional education system and who like to have fun. "

Source: Wikipedia, "Fuckstory (textová hra)" (Google Translated), available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Fuckstory 4: Fuckulta
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





User Summary

Fourth instalment of Fuckstory.

boardgame.name: Burtík
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Czech game about a guy who have been sent to prison and decide to leave. This takes his to plenty of wonderful places such as the Persian Gulf, Russia and Gabčíkovo while trying to escape the police.

boardgame.name: Jenseits des Nebelwalds
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Myranor mag vielen als völlig vom Imperium der dorinthapolischen Optimaten beherrscht erscheinen, aber nicht nur im Westen hat das Imperium seine geographischen und kulturellen Begrenzungen. Vor allem südlich des Meeres der Schwimmenden Inseln, der mittäglich anschließenden Dschungel und des großen Gebirgszugs von Tharamans Rippen (und dessen Fortsetzung im Tharpagiri-Gebirge) eröffnet sich eine gänzlich andere Welt: die Lande der Bansumiter.

Beginnend mit dem noch imperialen Tharpura und den von den Amaunir dominierten Schwesterlanden Makshapurams südlich des Tharpagiri über die weit ins Thalassion ausgreifenden Inseln des Archipels von Shindrabar reichen die Lande des zweiten großen Menschenvolks bis weit in die Narkramar. In dieser riesigen, lebensfeindlichen Wüste haben sich nicht nur autarke Stadtstaaten etabliert – die Eshbati –, sondern mit den Völkern der Dralquabar auch Menschengruppen dem Leben der Wüste völlig angepasst.
Auf den Inseln an der See des Schweigens – dem Archipel von Talaminas – und an den umgebenden Küsten, liegen die Reiche der Kerrishiter, eines Seefahrer- und Händlervolks, das dem Imperium schon lange die Seeherrschaft über das südliche Thalassion streitig macht.
Zwischen Pardir-Dschungel, Wolkenkämmen und Narkramar, oberhalb des Großen Kliffs und nördlich der Nacennia-Straße, liegt mit Te'Sumurru das einstige Herz bansumitischer Kultur, und mit den Ruinen der ehemaligen Hauptstadt Darshuria eines der großen Mysterien des myranischen Kontinents.
Neben den genannten Ländern und Kulturen der bansumitischen Menschen gibt es natürlich auch noch Regionen, die von den vielfältigen nichtmenschlichen Völkerschaften Myranors dominiert werden: Zuerst ist hier natürlich das Hochland von Alamar zu nennen, die Heimat der Ashariel, oder der Pardir-Dschungel im Südwesten des Meers der Schwimmenden Inseln, wo die grausamen Pantherwesen herrschen und Jharra sich verstecken, ebenso der Nebelwald zwischen Binnenmeer und Großem Kliff.
Gänzlich neu vorgestellt finden Sie die südwestlichen Lande Dragestans, wo sich Menschen, Felide und Echsenvölker unter der Herrschaft von Drachen zu einem Städtebund vereint haben. Und auch an der Nacennia-Straße gibt es trotz der dämonischen Verwüstungen noch Leben: Unter der Erde liegt das Reich von Narakam.

Reich illustriert und mit vielen Kartenausschnitten ausgestattet. Dieser Band ist die passende Ergänzung zur "Geographia Imperialis" Unter dem Sternenpfeiler, die sich mit den imperialen Landen und angrenzenden Regionen im Norden Myranors befasst.

boardgame.name: La Valse des Masques
boardgame.description:
La Valse des Masques (The waltz of masks)

16th century. You are the head of one of the 4 most respected and powerful noble families in Venice. You must use your power to maintain your family's influence and power in the Great Council. The future Doge must be in your favour! Use every trick in the book and reach the highest levels to rule the Republic of Venice!
Waltz of the Masks is a card game of actions, placements and combinations.

Objective of the game :
The main objective is to have the most influence points, and therefore usually the most "revealed" cards in the highest position, before the end of the game. The higher a "revealed" card is, the more influence value it has for the final count. Thematically, a high card is an advisor who influences the upper echelons of the city.

Players play cards in rows and push cards from the bottom row to the top. Cards can be played face up to perform card effects or face down to hide these effects until they come into force later in the game. Players cannot play the same card as the previous player, or the same card as the last player of the previous turn if you are the first player of the turn.

—description from publisher


Vous êtes à la tête d’une des 4 familles nobles les plus respectées et puissantes de Venise. Vous devez user de votre pouvoir afin de conserver l’influence et la puissance de votre famille au sein du Grand Conseil. Le futur Doge doit vous être favorable!
Usez de toutes les filouteries et atteignez les plus hautes sphères afin de régner en maître sur la République de Venise!
La Valse des Masques est un jeu de cartes d'actions, de placement et de combinaisons.

Objectif du jeu :
L’objectif principal est d’avoir le plus de points d’influence, et donc en général le plus de cartes “révélées” dans la position la plus haute, avant la fin de la partie.
Plus une carte “révélée” est haute, plus elle a de la valeur en influence pour le décompte final. Thématiquement, une carte haute est un conseiller qui influence les hautes sphères de la cité.

boardgame.name: The Goblin Hills
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

On the road down to the village, you admired the scenery: Majestic mountains and wind-blasted crags overlooking a fierce, rugged wilderness with tiny specks of civilization scattered throughout.

Arriving in town, you noticed the tense, fearful looks in the eyes of the locals. Militia men, too old or too young, clutch their spears while patrolling the palisades.

As you ask around, the villagers whisper one word in response:

“Goblin”

boardgame.name: Dark Woods of Winter
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the shadows.

This booklet will add a new area to adventure in, allowing your characters to grow, develop further and to encounter new and more terrifying threats.

Dark Woods of Winter is intended to be an “advanced” module to use once you have gotten some experience under your belt: The encounters are harder but hopefully the rewards will also be worth it.

Then again, many a traveler never returns from the woods. Why should you?

If the core Five Leagues book leaned into non-supernatural fantasy for the most part, this is also where the magical and the otherworldly gets turned up. As such, it will also present you with new challenges for the painting desk and your miniatures collection.

boardgame.name: Roads Well Traveled
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This expansion pack offers new people to encounter when you are out on your travels.

boardgame.name: Five Leagues from the Borderlands (2nd Ed)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Five Leagues from the Borderlands is a fantasy adventure game aimed specifically at soloplayers, though it can certainly be enjoyed with friends as well.

Create a band of adventurers and strike out for fame and fortune.

The borderlands are rife with bandits, monsters and potential treasure.

boardgame.name: Bedlam, the Board Game
boardgame.description:
Bedlam is a turn based game that employs versatile tile placement and card management.

Tiles will produce resources (gold and armies) and are the main mechanism for gaining points. Object of the game is to amass 10 points.

There are three categories of cards. Move cards enable you to relocate and gain valuable resources. Action cards are used to hinder or counteract your opponents game play. Instant cards are used at any time to help or hinder opponents and also contain secret points to assist in the objective.

Players are limited to 1 attack phase per turn and this mechanic is a basic 1-1 exchange. There are cards that can be used to eliminate armies without an attack and also to add to defense during an attack.

The game is not played on a set board, but is built by adding tiles during gameplay so each game will be different than the last.

—description from publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Baba Yaga
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Hansel and Gretel
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Jack and the Beanstalk

boardgame.name: Ultimate Shooting Collection
boardgame.description:
Packing three titles into one disc, this collection of shoot em ups contain some never before seen titles that are sure to please casual and hardcore fans of this genre! The Ultimate Shooting Collection is a must have for fans of the arcade shooter and brings the classic arcade feel to your living room. Ultimate Shooting Collection Key Features: 3 Unique and Distinct Shooters in One - Each shooter in this collection has a unique, never before seen play mechanics that separates it from the competition. This is the ultimate value and a shooter fans dream come true. Graphics - Each titles has great graphics that makes good use of the cell-shaded look, along with impressive bullet layouts that are visually stunning. The title is easy on the eyes for good reason as there will be countless number of bullets to keep your eyes glued to the screen. Gameplay - The included titles are all challenging in that players must perform a delicate balancing act between achieving a high score and staying alive. With unique gameplay mechanics specific to each title, and some that sets these shooters apart from every other arcade shooter in existence, you dont just play this shooter, you try and master it. Lasting Appeal and Options - Each title contains multiple options for the player, including 2-3 different ships which boast different weapons and special moves. If mastering one shooter takes a while, prepare a good chunk of time to perfect each one of these masterful shooters.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Slaughterville: Director's Cut
boardgame.description:
In Slaughterville Director’s Cut, the Villains, Characters, and Locations have been updated to be more in line with our new faster and deadlier style. It is a reimagining of Slaughterville and it can use all components from either/both of the previous editions of the game.

For example, the Serial Killer will leave clues at each Location, the Slasher will more more on the hunt, and more. Characters will get a facelift and Locations will get a needed boost.

Slaughterville Director's Cut is a 1-6 Player game of fun and horror. You will take on the role of one of our 28 characters, build a modular town, and choose one of our Villains to face off against. Each Villain affects the way that the game plays coming with their own win conditions and rules modifications to make the game thematic and fun!

Can you defeat the Villain?

—description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Slaughterville: The House on Haunted Hill Expansion

boardgame.name: Mindfulness Game
boardgame.description:
Mindfulness Games for Kids, Therapy Card Games: 3 Games in 1 Box, Fun Family Games That Teach Mindfulness, Social and Emotional Skills, Therapy Tools for Counselors and Teachers

Guess: A pack of cards with questions on each. Each player takes turns guessing how well they know their child/siblings. Every correct answer gets a sticker. The player with the most stickers wins!

Connect: A pack of cards with topics on each. Connect with your family members by answering the questions on a variety of topics. Every correct answer gets a sticker. The player with the most stickers wins!

Experiment: A pack of cards with a set of tasks and experiments. Everyone takes turns participating in the tasks. Each task shows how many points (stickers) the task is worth. The player with the most stickers wins!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: And Action!
boardgame.description:
And Action is a competitive card game about making movies for 2-6 players that takes 45-60 mins to play. You are a producer, racing to create and release movies by which you will earn fame.

In And Action, you collect sets of a script, actor, actress and director to form and release movies. Each character belongs to one of the specific genres: Action, Comedy, Mystery & Romance. You earn fame based on the genre of the script and character cards.

In addition, you can trade with other players, discard to/pick from a talent market and use event cards to reach your goal. Play the advanced version with Award Cards for even more variety. The producer with the highest fame at the end wins!

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Total Control Wrestling
boardgame.description:
Total Control Wrestling! The game where you decide how the storylines unfold on TV!

Total Control Wrestling provides players with an entire game system focused on a wrestling promotion with a weekly TV show. Every week, the show builds on the characters, storylines, feuds, and angles of the previous shows. It’s like watching your favorite weekly wrestling show on TV. You never know what will happen, who will show up, or what matches you may see. But one thing is for sure… it will lead to a knock-down, drag-out, feud-settling match down the road!

Create your own wrestlers or use those included in the game to get right into the action! The random creation process allows you to generate a wrestler’s physical stats, never knowing what you may get. Will it be a giant? Or a luchador? Then you decide the wrestler’s style and attributes to fit the prototype. Alternately, players can disregard the random process and assign any stats and attributes as they see fit, making the wrestler of their dreams! Perhaps you want to make replicas of the stars you watch on TV? You can do that, too!

The game system allows players to customize and use whatever elements they want and disregard the rest. Players can track everything built into the game system or use the most basic aspects for matches. Only want to use the Match Charts to determine winners in one-off matches? You can. Want to leave out the XP and Character Progression? You can do that without affecting the rest of the game. If detailing all the Feuds is too much work, leave that out and let the charts tell the stories from one show to the next. For the ultimate experience, get out some paper and pencils and run an entire promotion, keeping track of every stat, win, loss, storyline, angle, and feud from beginning to end.

The Chart Manual guides the general action of the TV show. However, players add the details, develop the personalities, and use their own creativity to enhance the show as it tells the stories from week-to-week. Angles, interviews, and scenarios will build Feuds between rivals until they can settle it once-and-for-all in the ring. New feuds will emerge, old feuds will re-start, wrestlers will turn on each other, and more! The game system provides the methods and means, but it is up to you to decide how and why it happened.

You have Total Control!

boardgame.name: Timber Tumble
boardgame.description:
A beaver stands on top of a haphazard dam made of wooden cylinders. Use the wand to knock the wooden logs out from under the beaver, slowly lowering it to the ground.

If you get the beaver to the ground without letting it fall, you win!

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Connecting Cubes
boardgame.description:
Players take turn placing cubes of their color onto a common place area. Get enough cubes in a row to win. Both game modes are characterized by there being no board and no limit to how far the common structure might expand as pieces are placed.

In mode A, players can only play flat onto the ground. They can expand the grid in any of 4 directions, but cannot stack cubes. Get 5 in a row to win.

In mode B, players can only play into a wall. They can expend it sideways in 2 directions or upwards. Get 4 in a row to in.

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Quintessence
boardgame.description:
Dans Nephilim Légende, vous jouez un esprit élémentaire antédiluvien qui s’incarne durant des moments-clés de l’histoire humaine. Au sein du monde occulte, vous tentez de déjouer les sombres complots des sociétés secrètes comme les Templiers. Grâce à votre Pentacle, qui est votre nature même, composé de Feu, d’Air, de Lune, d’Eau et de Terre, vous pratiquez comme nul autre les sciences occultes telles que la magie, la kabbale ou l’alchimie. Enfin, en achevant l’extraordinaire quête de l’Agartha, débutée bien avant la chute de l’Atlantide, vous tentez de trouver l’état ultime, celui de la perfection magique.

Avec ce livre de règles et de présentation, vous pourrez découvrir de manière simple l’univers de Nephilim. Fondées sur le fameux moteur de jeu D100 (celui qui motorisait les deux premières éditions de Nephilim), simplifié au maximum et comportant des éléments de game design innovants pour gérer les époques d’incarnation passées, la dangerosité d’un monde contemporain soumis au diktat des nouvelles technologies ou encore la finesse des enquêtes occultes, les règles sont rodées et robustes.

Nephilim Quintessence vous propose aussi une présentation simplifiée et complète du contexte de Nephilim, l’exposition de notre période contemporaine, Arcadia, la cité occulte qui constitue l’arc narratif permettant de relier entre eux les différents livres de cette édition.

Pour cette édition LudiKa, nous avons adjoint la campagne en 3 volets La Nouvelle Ys qui amplifie et complète le tout premier scénario jamais écrit pour Nephilim, faisant ainsi de Nephilim Quintessence un livre complet permettant de jouer immédiatement.

From Google Translaton: In Nephilim Legend, you play an antediluvian elemental spirit that is embodied during key moments in human history. Within the occult world, you attempt to thwart the dark plots of secret societies like the Templars. Thanks to your Pentacle, which is your very nature, composed of Fire, Air, Moon, Water and Earth, you practice like no other occult sciences such as magic, kabbalah or alchemy. Finally, by completing the extraordinary quest for Agartha, which began long before the fall of Atlantis, you attempt to find the ultimate state of magical perfection.

With this rule book and overview, you will be able to discover the universe of Nephilim in a simple way. Based on the famous D100 game engine (the one that powered the first two editions of Nephilim), simplified to the maximum and featuring innovative game design elements to manage past epochs of incarnation, the dangerousness of a contemporary world subject to diktat new technologies or even the finesse of occult investigations, the rules are honed and robust.

Nephilim Quintessence also offers you a simplified and complete presentation of the context of Nephilim, the exhibition of our contemporary period, Arcadia, the occult city which constitutes the narrative arc allowing to link together the different books of this edition.

For this LudiKa edition, we have added the 3-part campaign La Nouvelle Ys which amplifies and complements the very first scenario ever written for Nephilim, thus making Nephilim Quintessence a complete book to play immediately.

boardgame.name: Air Flix: Dunkirk – Battle Pack
boardgame.description:
Be part of one of the pivotal moments of modern military history with Evacuation Mode. Allied forces are desperately trying to get home, with Spitfire squadrons providing cover overhead but quickly running out of fuel, how many lives can they save?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Team Yankee: Czechoslovak People's Army – Warsaw Pact Forces in WWIII
boardgame.description:
The Czechoslovaks’ recent history with the Soviets had been rocky.
The liberalisation movement of the Prague Spring was supressed in 1968 by a Warsaw Pact invasion, followed by the reforming government being replaced by a more hard-line communist faction. There is some debate on how this may have impacted the performance of the Czechoslovak armed forces in any future war, but generally by the mid-eighties the army had recovered.
However, there was general unwillingness among the people to support an aggressive war against the west, but they were willing to fight if their country was threatened.

This briefing is a 24-page, full-colour booklet that comes with a complete set of 39 cards.

—description from the publisher
